loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Sarorn is a widow with 7 children. She has been in the business of planting vegetables on her plot of land in the village for more than 20 years. All of her children are under her guardianship. However, most of them have been working at the garment factory for almost 5 years. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA three times. The current loan amount is $700. She will use this loan to prepare the land, and purchase fertilizer to plant vegetables. She will also use the rest of the amount to repair the house. There will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Preparing the land, purchase fertilizer to plant vegetables.

loans.name: La

texts.en: Mr. S. La was married in 1990 and has 4 children. He is currently in the business of building boats. He started this business more than 13 years ago. He finished primary school but his wife has never attended school. His wife, Mrs. Choeurn Noeurn, is a housewife. All of his children are studying at the local school except the oldest daughter who is weaving silk at home. He has borrowed loans from MAXIMA  three times. The current loan amount is $1,000. He will use this loan to purchase some materials for building boats and buy silk material and sewing thread for his daughter as well. Since the first loan, he never had any problem repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase some materials for building the boat and purchase silk material and sewing thread.

payments.comment: Thank you very much to all leanders.

loans.name: Kim-Heak

texts.en: Kim-heak was married in 1977 and has 3 children. She is currently in the business of planting and selling flowers in the village. She started this business in 1993. Her husband also farms in the village. He has a tractor and contracts himself out to prepare land for villagers from one village to the next, so that he can generate extra income for the family. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount is $1,000. She will use this loan to repair the house. She has the ability to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To repair the house.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Kim-heak Chhim has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Eim

texts.en: Mrs. T. Eim was married in 1989 and has 4 children. She has been farming since 1985. She is currently planting and selling different kinds of vegetables and other food crops in the local market and sometimes brings them to sell in the city market. Her husband is a mason contractor in rural communities. With the profits from the family business, all of their children are able to go to school. This is her first loan from MAXIMA, and the loan amount is $300. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for planting vegetables and food crops. She has the ability to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Seam was married in 1976 and has 7 children. She learned to weave silk in 1992 from her neighbor and then started making silk in the same year. Besides that, her family also plants rice and raises cows in the village. Her husband plants the rice, and sometimes assists his wife in weaving silk when he is free from the rice farm.         

She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for four cycles already. The current loan amount is $600 which will be used to buy silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom. She is an existing client of MAXIMA and has the ability to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Seam Soun paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 29 years old and has a clothing shop in the Kirkuk market. He has one child. He has applied to get $ 1200 from AL-Aman to purchase more goods for his shop. He wants to develop himself and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is a 23-year-old single female who lives with her father. She has a hair salon and she wants to borrow $1200 to purchase new salon equipment. She wants to hire three women to work with her so that she can develop herself and her business and improve her income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment & hire assistants

loans.name: Karomad

texts.en:
Karomad started her business over 6 years ago. She is renting a place in the fruit and vegetable open-air market in Panjshanbe in Khujand. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is her business partner. He is responsible for bringing grapes from the districts of Khujand town. They are constant clients of several grapes farms, from which they buy their product. Every day her husband brings 50 kg of grapes from the farms and Karomad sells them during one day.

Their shop is located in a passage of the market and Karomad successfully sells her product. But her problem is the hot sun in the warm season. She wants to roof her shop. For this purpose she is requesting 600USD.

loans.use: Put  a roof on her shop

loans.name: Ulmasoy

texts.en:
Ulmasoy is a pensioner and mother of three children. She lives with her younger son’s family. But Ulmasoy is a person who could not sit at home. She is very cheerful and energetic. She wants to earn money and help her son to support his family.

Her business is the trade of household goods, which is located on the second floor of the Panjshanbe market. She is renting the little place outside of the shop, from which she takes goods and sells them in her trading place. She receives some profit from this activity.

She likes her business and wants to increase the number of her goods. For this purpose she is requesting 600USD. She wants to add new kinds of soap and shampoo to her assortment.

loans.use: Increasing the number of products

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina K. is married and has one son. She lives in Vinogradovo in western Ukraine. Antonina runs a small business selling china, glassware and pottery at the central city market. She has been in this trade for 6 years. Currently, her monthly gross income is about $2000. 

Antonina decided to start this business because of low competition in the market. Moreover, her family situation forced her to find ways to provide a stable income. Her son had been very sick for a while and Antonina had to work day and night to earn enough so she could buy necessary medication for him. Her perseverance, integrity, openness and natural cheerfulness have been key success factors for her business as they have ensured friendly relationships with her customers who willingly became her loyal clients. We believe her rich experience working in this sphere of business will help Antonina pass other significant business milestones and achieve even more success in her trade.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married. She lives in the town of Vinogradovo located in western Ukraine. Nadezhda sells shoes in the central mall in Vinogradovo. Her little store is well-known for having a big assortment of inventory. Nadezhda has been in business for five years and has rich experience working as a sales manager. She is very communicative, honest and responsible. 

Nadezhda is hoping to use this loan of $800 to purchase more footwear from wholesalers to sell in her store. She hopes that one day her business will expand enough to allow her to invest her profits and purchase her own vending facility. Nadezhda has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in her relationships with her suppliers and customers as well as when she has used lending services from Nadiya Ukraine. Prompt loan repayments and the stability of her business demonstrate her trustworthiness and capability of further loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase shoe inventory

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with two daughters. She sells women’s clothing in the central market of Melitopol. Marina has been in this trade for 13 years. She has been a client with Nadiya Ukraine for the past four years, maintaining a perfect credit history. Currently, she has about $1000 in inventory. Her gross monthly income is about $600 and her net profit is about $300. Marina is very diligent, communicative and charming. 

Marina is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase inventory for the upcoming fall season. She believes that financial assistance will help her increase the variety of clothing items she offers, and allow her to make additional profits to improve her family’s standard of living. Marina hopes that the uniqueness of her merchandise – she sells Hungarian linen clothing – will guarantee successful sales and good profits.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has a small clothing sales business located at one of the large markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. In the summertime she sells swimming suits and t-shirts, and in the wintertime she sells denim clothing and coats. Irina rents a little stand in the market for her business. She has also been able to put up a tent just across from her kiosk which gives her additional retail space. The business climate has changed a lot for Irina since she started selling back in the 1990’s. Today, there is much more competition from larger stores and shopping malls that did not exist when she was starting out. Irina has persevered through the changes that have taken place, doing the best she can to earn a living. Irina is a widow and has been raising her 17 year old son. He recently was able to start working as well which has brought some much needed income for the family. 

Irina has requested a loan to help purchase some new inventory for her business. She would like to begin stocking items such as backpacks, skirts, and shirts that will be popular as students head back to school in September. We are happy to have this opportunity to continue assisting Irina with her business and livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en: Sergei earns a living by driving a taxi around the city of Ivano-Frankovsk in western Ukraine. He has been in business for about seven years and makes about 150-170 Ukrainian Hrivna, or around $30-35 per day. Sergei rents his car and works with a taxi dispatching company that radios taxi requests to affiliated drivers. He tries to rent a newer car every year which helps him provide a better experience for his customers. Sergei is married and has one daughter who is fourteen. His earnings provide the main income for his family. Sergei has requested a short term loan to help cover the expense of some routine maintenance on his car. Sergei’s good reputation among fellow taxi drivers and his dedication to his business give us confidence that he will be able to successfully repay this loan.

loans.use: Taxi repair

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is single. He lives in Melitopol, Ukraine. After his parents were tragically killed in a car accident, his mother’s friend took care of Alexei, helping him with his schooling and with starting his business. He became an entrepreneur after his mother’s friend suggested he should start his own venture. Today he runs a business selling office supplies. He rents a facility in one of the busy local malls which is a very favorable location. Alexei has been in this business for 2 years. Presently, he has about $3000 in inventory. His gross income per month is about $1200 and his net monthly profit is about $600.  

He is requesting a loan of $300 to increase the range of inventory in his store. He is planning to develop his business and improve his living standards. He hopes to use generated profits to do some remodeling in his apartment. We believe his diligence, determination and good credit history will guarantee the further success of his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan G. is married. He and his wife, Eve, live in Vinogradovo, in the Transcarpathian region of western Ukraine. He owns a café located in the central market of Vinogradovo which is a very favorable and busy location. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have had a positive impact on the growth of Ivan’s business. Using loan capital, he remodeled the interior of his café and purchased new equipment and dishware. Ivan has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, his gross income is about $1000 - $1600 a month and his monthly net profit is about $400. Ivan is a very punctual, hard-working business owner.  

Ivan is requesting a loan to purchase more beverages (juices, fizzy drinks, mineral water, etc.) and groceries for his café. He believes the loan will help him better serve his customers and please different tastes. We are confident the that reasonable prices, delicious food and friendly customer-service that Ivan offers will ensure the success of his business and help him fulfill one of his long-term plans – to open a second café in his little town.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for cafe

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a widow with a grown son named Arthur. She lives in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. Liana sells groceries (cereal, noodles, coffee, tea, fruit and veggies, etc.) in the local market. It is her only source of income. She has been in this business for 16 years and has gained many loyal customers. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine and her personal strengths have ensured the successful growth of Liana’s trade. She is an enterprising and active hard-worker who usually works long hours. Her customers have only positive references for her. Liana has repaid nine previous loans without any delinquencies

Liana is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase new types of food inventory and attract new customers. We believe her constant desire to see her business grow and expand is her best motivation and guarantees prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase groceries wholesale

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is divorced with one son. She lives in Uzhgorod, Ukraine and sells meat (beef, pork, etc.) at one of the local markets in downtown Uzhgorod. Tamara usually purchases big parts of meat from stock-breeders in the villages at good prices and then resells it in the city where she can earn a good profit. She is well-known at the market because the meat she sells is always fresh and good. Tamara has been a market vendor for the past 10 years. She is very cheerful, confident and strong-willed. 

Currently, Tamara has a nice range of meats for sale at her stall. She maintains about $3000 worth of meat on hand. She is requesting a loan of $500 to help purchase more meat for further sale. She is hoping to use her profits to pay for her son’s education in college. One of her long-term plans is to open a meat store and provide more jobs for people. She loves her job a lot and is hoping to grow both professionally and economically.

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow with two children. Her husband died of cancer. Nataliya’s daughter is divorced and her son is in prison. Despite these hardships in life, Nataliya has managed to run a successful small business selling sells toys and clothing in the local market and support her family. Currently, she has two vending facilities which bring in good profits.

Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped the growth of Nataliya’s business. She purchased a vending stall and has been able to offer a better assortment of inventory as a result of loan capital. She has requested a new loan that will give her more working capital to use in developing her business. We believe her ability to make profitable sales and ensure that her products are chosen in response to the needs of her customers will help Nataliya boost her sales and succeed in her trade.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married and lives in Zaporozhye in south central Ukraine. He used to work in a factory. However, after the times of perestroika and the collapse of the Soviet Union, he resigned and started working as a market vendor. Unfortunately, he was unable to make enough at that time to meet his family’s basic needs so he decided to try working in construction. After working there for some time his health began to deteriorate and he was forced to quit. In the meantime, his wife had begun working at the market trying to make ends meet and so Yuryi decided to join her. He was able to get enough money together to purchase a supply of batteries, bulbs, dishware, and other small items to start a small vending kiosk. Today, Yuryi has a successful business selling household items in one of the local markets. 

Previous loans have secured the sustainability of Yuryi’s business by promoting his sales and allowing him to purchase a new vending stall. Currently, he has two vending facilities which operate efficiently bringing him stable income. Yuryi is requesting a loan of $500 to increase his available working capital. We believe Yuryi’s integrity and responsibility will help him further progress towards his goals and objectives.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with two teenage sons. She lives in the town of Kamenka-Dneprovskaya located in central Ukraine. Yevgeniya runs a business selling practical household items, books and office supplies. Both she and her husband were knowledgeable in the area of office related products so when she started the business it was a good fit for her. She currently works in one of the local markets of Kamenka. Her vending kiosk is very spacious which allows her to easily re-stock her supplies and increase her inventory. It is also in a favorable location which helps attract potential customers. Yevgeniya is a sharp business owner and stays on the lookout for new and updated products that will sell well. 

Yevgeniya has repaid 10 loans from Nadiya Ukraine with no defaults. She is grateful for the financial support which has helped to make her business a success. Yevgeniya has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a supply of household items to sell in her kiosk. She is hoping that these new items will help her business continue to be successful and will allow her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit for his micro-business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a varied inventory of fruit for his micro-business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phone airtime for resale to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing inventory

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora has dedicated herself to selling cosmetics and perfumes. She sells a line of perfumes manufactured in Guayaquil called Yanbal. When Aurora’s husband had a hard time finding a job, she quit her job as full time mom and opened her shop, Cosméticos Esmeralda, in order to support the family.

She is asking for this, her second loan, in order to increase the selection of perfumes for her customers. She took out her previous loan in December, which proved profitable because cologne and perfume are popular things to save up for and give as gifts.

Although her relationship with her husband is shaky, they individually work hard to provide for their children. Her wish is to be able to earn enough money from operating Cosmeticos Esmeralda so that she can cover the costs of living for herself and the remaining kids who still live in the home.

loans.use: Continue investing in cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Joffre

texts.es:
Business Description

Joffre has 10 years of experience in business. He started his current business doing ironwork with a little capital he had been able to obtain with his former bakery, which he had to close due to the economic conditions in the country and their effect on small businesspeople. For this business he uses part of his home. He makes doors, windows, and grills. He works every day of the week from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Loan Use

Joffre needs this loan to invest in the purchase of materials for his work, because demand has increased and he wants to fulfill his clients' requests. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity to expand his business and improve the quality of his services.

Personal Information

Joffre is 34 years old. He has 3 children who are in school. His wife works taking care of the home. Their house is of mixed construction (part cane, part concrete). They have two small rooms which they rent out. In this way, they generate other income for the household. His desire is to have a well-equipped workshop, and also to create jobs for other people.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción D. Negocio

Joffre tiene una experiencia de 10 años en el comercio. Su negocio actual de cerrajería lo inicio con un poco de capital que logro obtener de su antigua panadería, la cual tuvo que cerrar por motivos D. estado económico que sufrió el país y afecto a los pequeños comerciantes. Para su negocio ocupa parte de su vivienda. Se dedica a la elaboración de puertas, ventanas, rejas. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Uso D. Préstamo

Joffre necesita D. préstamo para invertir en la compra de material de trabajo. Ya que su demanda ha aumentado y espera poder cumplir con sus clientes. Aprovechando la oportunidad de expandir su negocio ofreciendo y mejorando la calidad de sus servicios

Información Personal

Joffre tiene 34 años. Tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando. Su esposa se dedica a la atención y cuidados D. hogar. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Posee 2 cuartitos que arrienda. De esta manera genera otros ingresos al hogar. Su deseo es poder tener su taller bien equipado. Además de crear fuentes de trabajo para otras personas.

loans.use: To buy materials for his work

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Business Description

Reina sells clothing and shoes, both from her home and as a traveling salesperson. She has been self employed for 25 years. She services her customers seven days a week, from 7 AM to 6 PM, leaving her home early in the morning to travel to adjacent areas.

Loan Use

Reina is requesting this loan to purchase additional clothing and shoes, as these are the basis of her business. Having additional inventory will allow her to provide more choices to her clients, which will translate into more income. She needs to increase her inventory in order to meet an increased demand for her goods, a reflection of her hard work.

Personal Information

Our friend Reina is 55 years old and currently lives with her brother and sister-in-law, who support her in her business endeavors and have agreed to let her live with them. Reina states that her hard work has paid off because she's among family. She helps with home expenses as best she can. Her hope is to be able to increase her inventory to better serve her clients and, as a result, increase her income. This, in turn, will allow her to help her brother replace their home's dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Reina se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, conjuntos, pantalones y todo tipo de vestimentas que le ofrece a sus clientes, tanto en su domicilio como fuera de la ciudad. Reina tiene 25 años de experiencia trabajando independientemente. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, saliendo desde temprano de su domicilio y recorriendo los lugares aledaños a la ciudad.

Uso del Préstamo

Reina solicita el crédito para la compra de más ropa y vestimentas que es la base fundamental de su negocio, para así ofrecerles a sus clientes variedades de modelos de ropa y zapatos, de tal modo que pueda generar más ingresos. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener. Reina necesita incrementar su negocio para poder cumplir con su los pedidos de sus clientes. Los mismos que ha obtenido con el diario esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Información Personal

Nuestra amiga Reina tiene 55 años de edad, en la actualidad vive con familiares, su hermano y cuñada quienes la apoyan con su negocio y están de acuerdo en que ella viva con ellos. Reina indica que su esfuerzo es recompensado ya que en ellos tiene una familia. Reina ayuda en el mantenimiento del hogar en lo que pueda. Los anhelos de Reina es comprar mas mercadería para ofrecerles a sus clientes, así se sientan bien atendidos y conformes con los productos que nuestra cliente les ofrece incrementar sus ingresos. De esta manera podrá también ayudar a su hermano en la construcción del piso , porque es de tierra.

loans.use: Reina will buy additional clothing items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and to purchase store fixtures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in additional merchandise

loans.name: Ahou

texts.en:
K. Ahou E. is a dynamic 30-year-old woman. She lives in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. E. is a tailor and she has been working for herself for more than 6 years. She operates in the Port-Bouët open market where she makes children's garments.

E. wants to acquire electric sewing machine and purchase a stock of textiles to make school uniforms for September and October. E. joined the AE&I microcredit program in June, 2006 and has benefited from a micro-loan that she reimbursed in good manner. E. is well organized and ambitious.

loans.use: Konan Ahou Eugenie will use the loan  acquire an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa O. is a dynamic and ambitious 26-year-old man. He lives in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. Moussa opened a fashionware store in Port-Bouët open market 5 years ago when his parents asked him to emigrate to Europe. Moussa, who is a self-confident man, decided to built his own micro business in Cote d'Ivoire iinstead of leaving for an uncertain adventure in Europe.

He has performed very well and has developed his business. Moussa joined the AE&I microcredit program when he heard about our activities from his sister in 2005. He has always repaid his loans in good manner.

loans.use: Moussa Osseni will use the loan to purchase a stock of fashion clothes

loans.name: Amon Marie

texts.en: O. Amon Marie is a dynamic 42-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. Marie lives with her family in Treichville, a popular and commercial district in the south of Abidjan. Marie wholesales various fruits such as cola nuts in the Treichville open market. Marie, whose children go all to school, is the main resources provider for her family. She is very well organized and rigorous. She has always repaid her loans in good manner. She wants to purchase in bulk a stock of cola nuts from the field in the northern region of Côte d’Ivoire for export to neighbouring  Ghana. This is a good business opportunity for Marie.

loans.use: Amon Marie will use the loan to purchase a stock of cola nuts to export

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Ms. Petrona F. is 60 years old, single, and has 5 sons now of age. She lives with her sons and nieces making it a house of 10 people. Thanks to her hard work and dedication in her diner, she has been able to recently purchase her own house where they all live.

She works in a diner cooking for over 50 employees of a ship. Her sons also help in her selling fast food meals such as empanadas, milanesas, sandwiches, tortillas, etc. Aside from breakfast, lunch, and dinner, she also offers edibles at her stand such as sweets and drinks. She requires the loan to be able to expand her patio to be able to house more customers as well as to provide them with further commodities. She also needs the money to be able to buy more kitchen products as the current ones are getting old.

She is a part of a group of 15 female entrepreneurs who name themselves “Juntas Podemos” (“We can do it together”).

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils such as pots, frying pans, plates, forks, spoons, and knives.

loans.name: Elena Martina

texts.en:
Elena Martina C. is just 17 years old, but has been weaving beautiful huipiles, the traditional Mayan blouse, since she was a child. She can turn out one of these works of art in about fifteen days of weaving, and then can sell it for almost US$200, realizing a profit of about US$130 for her work after purchasing the yarn. She sells to her neighbors who check on her work and may place an order when they see something they like.

Elena Martina is still single and her goal right now is to finish high school with a secretarial specialization. Later on she'd like to open a store to sell woven goods in the town center. She'll invest this credit, as always, in yarn for weaving.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina B. B. is 27 and earns her monetary income by weaving beautiful Mayan huipiles, the traditional blouse the women wear in the mountains of western Guatemala. Weaving each huipil takes about two months' work, and she can sell one for almost US$200, making a profit of about US$150. As she has in her loans for the last few years, she'll invest in yarn for the weaving.

Two of Joaquina's four kids are in school, although she herself didn't make it past the second great and can only read a little bit (but she can sign her own name). Her husband works far away and she hasn't seen him for two years, but he faithfully helps with supporting the kids. Joaquina, however, has to take full responsibility for care of the kids. She's a member of the women's group "Flor de Nebaj".

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa B. is 27 and runs a little stand selling fresh-cooked chuchitos (a kind of tamale), tacos, and a delicious rice drink. She'll use this credit to purchase the raw materials she uses for the food she prepares, including corn and beans. Rosa sells to people passing by on their way to the nearby hospital, so she has an excellent location, and can clear as much as US$13 per day. Her stand is open five days a week, all year around.

Rosa's three children (6, 8, and 9) are basically healthy, which is a blessing. The school-age kids are in school. Rosa herself finished the fourth grade, so she can read, unlike many of her peers.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her business, including corn and beans

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru:
Maftuna is 19. She lives with her parents. Both parents work as controllers at Ispharinskiy Chemical Plant and receive scanty pay. Maftuna’s business provides a sizable contribution to her family’s income. Maftuna sells fried sunflower seeds, chewing gum, cigarettes, and other small items at the town’s bus terminal. The business is doing well, because there are plenty of buyers at the station. To buy her goods, Maftuna travels to neighboring Uzbekistan. She is a Tajik citizen and it is not easy for her to cross the border. Because the goods cost less in Uzbekistan, Maftuna must continue her trips in spite of many difficulties. Maftuna has been a MicroInvest borrower for half a year. She used her loan to expand her business slightly and purchase the necessary amount of goods. Now, many of the goods that Maftuna is selling have gone up in price. She plans to use the new loan to purchase more goods.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мафтуне 19 лет. Она живет с родителями. Отец и мать работают контролерами на Исфаринском химическом заводе и получают мизерную по нынешним временам заработную плату. Бизнес, которым занимается Мафтуна, вносит весомый вклад в семейный бюджет. Мафтуна продает жареные семечки, жевательную резинку, сигареты и другие мелкие товары на городском автовокзале. Торговля идет хорошо, так как покупателей очень много. Для закупки товара Мафтуна ездит в соседний Узбекистан. Для нее как гражданина Таджикистана существует проблема пересечения границы, но товар там стоит дешевле и Мафтуне приходится несмотря на трудности ездить в Узбекистан. В Микроинвест Мафтуна кредитуется полгода. С помощью займа она намного расширила свой бизнес, закупила необходимое количество товара. Сейчас многие товары, которые она продает, повысились в цене. Новый займ она хочет потратить на закупку товаров.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru:
When the life conditions became completely unbearable, Salima went to sell on a market. This was 6 years ago. For the last several years, Salima’s husband has been away working as a seasonal laborer in Russia. He earns very little. The irregular money transfers that he sends are not enough to pay for necessities. Salima has 3 children. One of her daughters is mentally retarded and sits at home. Salima tries anything that might bring extra income. She specializes in sale of dried fruits (apricots and prunes). During the summer, when melons and watermelons appear on the market, Salima switches to sell them. Salima’s older daughter helps her mother to sell. Over the 5 months of being a MicroInvest borrower, Salima demonstrated that MicroInvest loans made a noticeable difference in her business. Salima plans to continue her relationship with MicroInvest, as the loans she receives help her sustain her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Когда условия жизни Салимы стали совсем невыносимыми она вышла на базар торговать. Это произошло 6 лет назад. Ее муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках, но зарабатывает очень мало. Деньги высылает нерегулярно, и присланных не хватает на жизнь. У Салимы 3 детей, одна из дочерей умственно отсталая в развитии, и сидит дома. Салима старается заниматься всем тем что приносит прибыль. Основная направленность – это продажа сухофруктов (чернослив, абрикосы). В летний сезон, когда на базаре появляются арбузы и дыни Салима, переходит на их продажу. В торговле ей помогает ее старшая дочь. Кредитуется 5 месяцев и за это время займы Микроинвест внесли заметный вклад в ее бизнес. Салима и дальше собирается сотрудничать с Микроинвест, так как займы помогают ей поддержать ее бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Shahnoza’s entire family is engaged in business. Shahnoza and her mother travel to purchase goods in Khudzhand and Karosoo, Kyrgyzstan. Her father sells on markets (he is on the photo). Shahnoza is not married and lives with her parents. She has been in business for 5 years and has gained considerable expertise in running a business. Shahnoza sells food products and a variety of small items. The small items are sold retail on markets, while food products are sold wholesale. Recently, Shahnoza received a loan from MicroInvest. She used the money to purchase household goods. Now she plans to take another loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вся семья Шахнозы занята в бизнесе. Шахноза и мама ездят за товаром в Худжанд и Каросуу, Кыргызстан. Отец торгует на базарах. Шахноза не замужем и живет с родителями. Шахноза в бизнесе уже 5 лет и за это время она приобрела большой опыт в ведении бизнеса. Ассортимент товаров огромный и включает в себя от продуктов питания до разной мелочевки. В розницу на базарах продают хозяйственные мелочи, а продукты питания продают оптом. Шахноза недавно получила займ в Микроинвест. На полученный займ она закупила хозяйственные товары. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena B. B., 43, weaves traditional Mayan women's clothing, including shawls, huipiles, and head dressings which are quite unique in this region. The huipiles are special women's tops that can take up two months to make, depending on the details and the design. Her customers are the women of the town who are in need of a new huipil and will pay up to US$275 for her weavings. She has taught all her daughters this traditional Mayan art that has been created in the same way for 400 years.

Magdalena lost her husband four months ago after a four-year battle with tuberculosis. She now is the sole support of her 6 children and she somehow manages to send all her children to school, except for the youngest who will attend next year. Magdalena struggles with some stomach problems; the kids are generally healthy, but have not come to terms with the loss of their dad. In order to purify their drinking water they boil it. They do not have electricity and she cooks by wood. She speaks Ixil, the Mayan language spoken in Nebaj. Unlike many people, she does own enough land to grow corn to feed her family.

With this loan she will buy more yarn to weave and some stock for the small store she is developing. Her ultimate goal is to weave enough so she can purchase enough product to fully stock her little store.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana C. M., 55, is the owner of a food stall which sells cooked food and snack foods like chips, tacos, juice, water, and sodas. She first started her business 20 years ago when they built the hospital near her home. With this loan she will restock her store. She likes the Friendship Bridge credit program because she can make monthly payments; some other programs require a single large capital payment at the end of the cycle.

Juana is married and had 13 children, two of whom died quite young, and two more died as children. She has ten grandchildren. Her dream is to take care of all the children and send all of them to school - so far she has succeeded. Although she's had some health issues, the family is pretty healthy.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase food for business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. C., 41, opened her small tienda (Spanish for a little store) four years ago with her first loan from the Kiva MFI partner, Friendship Bridge. She sells juices, water, crackers, and sodas from her wooden stall at the gate of the local hospital in Nebaj. With this new loan she will buy products to stock her store. Before she got her first loan and opened up the tienda, she used to sell chuchitos (a type of tamale wrapped in banana leaves) on the street.

Juana is married and has five children ranging in age from nine months to eighteen years. All the children are physically healthy and the two school-age boys attend school. When they are not in school, they work with other members of the family in their corn fields. Although Juana never learned to read or write, she speaks both Spanish and her native tongue Ixil.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase stock for the store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena G. B., 18, weaves traditional Mayan clothes. She lives in Nebaj, where all the women in her family make huipiles, the beautiful woman's top with woven designs of birds and trees. She can make two huipiles in a month and see them for US$200 up to $250. She sells to other women in the town who are looking for fresh clothes of this type.

Elena will use this loan to buy yarn and also to buy some products for the small store she and her mother are trying to expand. The ultimate goal is to expand the little store into a well-stocked general store.

Elena is still working on her schooling - she's in Junior High school and goes every Sunday for the weekend program. She hopes to finish her high school specialization in the next 3-4 years.

Her dad died four months ago after a four-year battle with tuberculosis, so Elena has to help with her younger siblings. Her sister is particularly sad right now, perhaps having a hard time understanding the death of their father.

Elena speaks and can read and write Spanish in addition to her native Ixil, the local Mayan language.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Muazzamhon

texts.ru:
Год назад Муазамхон взяла свой первый займ в Микроинвест на переработку и сушку абрикосов. Этот займ принес ей хорошую прибыль, и она решила кредитоваться дальше. Муазамхон 39 лет, она замужем и у нее 4 детей – 2 мальчика и 2 девочки. Ее муж работает в «нонвойхоне» (цехе по производству национального таджикского хлеба - лепешки). Заработка мужа хватает на питание семьи. Для покупки чего-либо большего денег на хватает. Муазамхон несколько лет назад решила заняться бизнесом. Постепенно расширяя бизнес она арендовала торговое место в магазине. Сейчас ассортимент ее товаров включает в себя детскую одежду и обувь для всех возрастов. За товаром она ездит раз в неделю на оптовый рынок расположенный в 170 км от ее дома. У Муазамхон много постоянных клиентов и прибыль от бизнеса вносит весомый вклад в семейный бюджет. Наступает пора сезона школьных форм и Муазамхон планирует получить займ для закупа этих форм.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

A year ago, Muazzamhon took her first MicroInvest loan to process and dry apricots. The loan brought Muazzamhon a nice profit, so she decided to do it again. Muazzamhon, 39 is married and has 4 children—2 boys and 2 girls. Her husband works on “nonvoykhone” (a bakery that produces Tajik traditional bread—lavash). The money that Muazzamhon’s husband makes is enough only to buy food and nothing else. A few years ago, Muazzamhon started her business. Gradually expanding, she rented a trading spot in a store. Now, Muazzamhon sells clothing for children and shoes for all ages. Once a week, she travels to buy her goods from a wholesaler located 170 km away from her home. Muazzamhon has many regular customers and the profit that her business makes constitutes a sizable contribution to her family’s budget. School season is approaching, and Muazzamhon asks for a loan to order school uniforms.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoes & clothing retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of used clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Chouy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chouy K. is 30 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She is a vendor selling grilled chicken near Kulen Mountain, where a number of tourists pass by. She generally earns up to $5 each day, while her husband makes approximately $ 5/day in revenue from working as a merchant buying and selling woods.

Mrs. Chouy K. would like to add more supplies to her inventory, but she faces a financial constrain. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to help her.

loans.use: To add more supplies for her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a buiness of selling Charcoal and paraffin.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yorn is widowed with 3 children. She learned to weave silk in 1970 from her mother and she started making silk production since then. But stopped weaving during the Khmer Rouge regime and she began to weave again after 1979. She never goes to school.           

She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for five cycles already. The current loan amount is $600. She will use this loan to buy silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom and setting up one more loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom and setting up one more loom.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Yorn Chim has enough money to pay off her loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old has a small shop in the Kirkuk market. He has applied to get $1000 to paint the shop and purchase more goods. He live with his family, and he wants to enhance his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: paint the shop and purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat has been selling children shoes for 7 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough for supporting the family, so she decided to help her husband.

Rohat’s business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe. She brings her goods from Istaravshan’s wholesale market. Rohat usually buys 100-150 pair of children’s shoes every trip. Her son helps her to carry her big bags of shoes.

Rohat became a client of Micro Invest in 2005. Her first loan was $100. She spent her first loan for buying 50 pair of shoes. Gradually she increased the volume of her goods. Today her stall is one of the best-known stalls in the market. She has many clients and she always wants to meet their needs.

Now Rohar wants to rent a trading place for her son. She is requesting $500 for it.

loans.use: Rent a trading place

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married mother of 3 children. She is a hardworking woman who strives to see development in her local area of Nyahera . She belongs to a group of women who have come together to venture seriously into the pottery-making industry. Most people prefer clay ware as it lasts longer and is high-quality and economical.

She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business and to purchase all that is needed to make her business a success.

She belongs to a self-help women's group in Kisumu Kenya, called 'Ongeza Maarifa' which is a Swahili phrase meaning "increase your wisdom." They make a variety of products and are particularly involved in a project termed 'jiko kisasa' (earthen oven/cooker). This cooker was recently introduced and due to the high demand, the group is targeting to buy a kiln with higher capacity than the one currently in use. They also need to purchase a vehicle which would provide them a quicker and more efficient means of transporting their goods.

loans.use: To fund her pottery business

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза незамужем, ей 23 года и живет с родителями. Ее бизнес начался 4 года назад, когда она впервые вышла торговать. Вначале она помогала матери а затем и сама стала привозить и продавать товар. Ее ассортимент включает в себя резиновую летнюю обувь, которую она продает в летний сезон. Зимой она переходит на торговлю зимней детской одеждой. Ей помогает 2 младшие сестренки. Полученную прибыль она частью вкладывает в расширение своего бизнеса, а остальное тратит на семейные расходы. В этом заключается ее вклад в семейный бюджет. В Микроинвест она кредитуется уже полгода и ее бизнес заметно продвинулся. Сейчас она собирается и дальше расширять свой бизнес и хочет получить новый займ.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Firuza, 23 is not married and lives with her parents. She started her business 4 years ago, when she first began to sell. Initially, she helped her mother, but then Firuza began to deliver and sell her goods independently. Her assortment of goods includes rubber shoes, which she sells in the summer. In the winter, Firuza switches to selling winter clothing for children. Firuza gets help from her two younger sisters. She invests a share of her profits into expansion of her business and spends the rest to cover her family's expanses. Since becoming a MicroInvest customer half a year ago, Firuza has shown a noticeable progress in business. Now, she needs a new loan to continue business expansion.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Malohat is married with 5 children. She sells sunflower seeds, cigarettes and other retail goods at the Central Bus Station in Isfara town. Her oldest daughter helps her out with the sales. Malohat's husband still works for a collective farm, but his salary is way to low to support the family. The profits from Malohat's small business help with many family needs. The oldest daughter is going to get married and the parents want one of their sons to get married too. They are saving part of the profits for the weddings. Previously Malohat took out a loan from Microinvest and used it to buy more goods for sale. She is requesting another loan to expand her business and improve her work place (to buy a market umbrella).

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Малохат замужем и у нее 5 детей. она торгует мелкими товарами и семечками на центральном автовокзале г. Исфары. Ей помогает ее старшая дочь. Ее муж работает в колхозе, но зарабатывает очень маленькую зарплату. На жизнь ее естественно не хватает. Малохат приходится выходить торговать. Это приносит доход, на который живет семья. Ее старшая дочь должна выйти замуж, а сына она собирается женить. Для этого нужны деньги. Часть прибыли от торговли она откладывает на свадьбу. Чтобы получить дополнительную прибыль она получила займ в Микроинвест. На полученный займ она закупила семечки и сигареты. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и дальше расширить свой бизнес и улучшить условия своего торгового места (приобрести зонт для защиты от солнца).

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a widowed mother of six and belongs to a self-help women's group in Kisumu, Kenya, called 'Ongeza Maarifa,' which is a  Swahili  phrase meaning "increase your wisdom." 
They make a variety of products and are particularly involved in a project
 termed 'jiko kisasa' (earthen oven/cooker). This cooker was recently introduced, 
and due to the high demand, the group is targeting to buy a kiln with higher capacity 
than the one currently in use.
They also need to purchase a vehicle which would enable them a
 quicker and more efficient means of transporting their goods. She hopes that this loan will not only enable her to develop her business but also, with time, be able to send her children to the university.

loans.use: To fund her business for expansion

loans.name: Otawaye

texts.en:
Otawaye A. is a strong and dynamic 54-year-old tradesman. He is married and has 5 children. Otawaye and his family live in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. For a number of years, he has sold fashionable women's wear in the Port-Bouët open-air market. This business is the main financial resource from which he ensures his family's household needs and pays his children's education expenses.

Otawaye is an honest and rigorous micro-businessman. He received his first micro-loan from AE&I in November 2004 and has been a very good performer ever since. He wants to enlarge his inventory of ladies' summer dresses to improve his profit margin and be able to pay university tuition and fees for his oldest daughter who will start law school at Abidjan University in October 2007.

loans.use: to expand his women's wear inventory

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.en:
O. Fatoumata is a 35-year-old single mother. She lives with her daughter in Koumassi, a township in the south of Abidjan. Fatoumata produces and sells various exotic aromatic products in the Koumassi open-air market. She has had this micro-business for about 6 years and has a good reputation among her target customers. Fatoumata’s 8-year-old daughter goes to primary school. She has been able to pay her daughter’s school tuition and fees from her business and is very proud to have been able to do so.

Dynamic and ambitious, Fatoumata wants to expand her business and increase her revenue. She wants to improve the packaging of her products and hopes in future to be able to transfer her business to better, more hygienic premises.

loans.use: to improve the packaging of her products

loans.name: Kouame

texts.en:
Mrs Kouame N. K. is 48 years old. She is married and has 8 children. She lives in Treichville, a popular commercial district in the south of Abidjan. She sells agricultural products wholesale in the Treichville open-air market.

Ms. K. wants to go to the western region of Cote d’Ivoire in order to purchase a stock of yams as it is the production season in that area. This will substantially improve her profit margin and thus her income. Ms.K., whose husband is retired from his job as a secretary at the Ministry of Transport, is presently the main bread-winner for her family.

loans.use: purchase a stock of goods

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
ANTONIA is 33 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her husband works in the fields, planting corn, and she works selling fruits and vegetables from door to door, and she also makes corn tostadas and sells them from her home to people in the community. She is part of the group Sausal 3, along with Ms. EMILIA GOMEZ MENDEZ and Ms. CARMELA SANCHEZ L. (both of whom work making and selling tostadas. With this loan, they will buy large quantities of corn and wholesale firewood, which they will distribute amongst themselves to increase their production and their sales.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

ANTONIA, tiene 33 años, casada tiene 7 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de casa en casa y además prepara tostadas de maíz y las vende en su casa a las gentes de su comunidad. Forma parte del grupo Sausal 3 junto con doña EMILIA GOMEZ MENDEZ y doña CARMELA SANCHEZ L. ( ambas se dedican a hacer y vender tostadas ).Con El préstamo comprar quintales de maíz , leña al por mayor y repartirse para aumentar la producción y sus ventas.

loans.use: the sale of fruits, vegetables, and tostadas

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
CRISTINA is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children. She works making handcrafted bracelets and belts out of silk thread, and she sells them to people who have handicrafts booths at the market in Santo Domingo. She also has in her home a small grocery store. She is part of the group Flores de Magnon 1, along with JOSEFA JIMENEZ V. (handicrafts), FRANCISCA JIMENEZ JIMENEZ (grocery store), REGINA GOMEZ JIMENEZ (grocery store), and DIEGA JIMENEZ V. (grocery store). With this loan, the group hopes to buy merchandise (such as sugar, salt, oil, crackers, pasta, and other non-perishable food) wholesale, and in this way supply their respective businesses by distributing the merchandise.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CRISTINA , tiene 36 años , casada , tiene 5 hijos , ella se dedica a hacer pulseras y cinturones artesanales con hilos de seda y los vende a las personas que tienen locales comerciales de artesanías en el mercado de Santo Domingo , también tiene en su casa instalada una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes . Forma parte del grupo Flores de Magnon 1, junto con JOSEFA JIMENEZ V. ( artesana ) , FRANCISCA JIMENEZ JIMENEZ ( tienda de abarrotes ) , REGINA GOMEZ JIMENEZ ( tienda de abarrotes), DIEGA JIMENEZ V. (tienda de abarrotes) . Con el préstamo esperan comprar mercaderías tales como : azúcar , sal , aceite, galletas , pastas y alimentos no perecibles al por mayor y así surtir sus respectivos negocios al repartirse las mercaderías.

loans.use: grocery store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam O. is a dynamic 43-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. She lives with her family in Koumassi, a township in the south of Abidjan.

Mariam sells various candies and biscuits in the Koumassi open-air market. Mariam's husband who is a librarian lost his job in June 2005 and ever since then, she has been the main bread-winner for her family. Ambitious and well organized, Mariam joined AE&I micro-credit program in March 2004, when she heard about the program from her sister. She has already received several micro-loans that she has reimbursed in a timely manner.

loans.use: expand the inventory of her little shop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
CECILIA is 23 years old, married, three children. Her husband works in the fields. She has a small grocery store in her home, and she also buys bread from a bakery and sells it retail in her store. She is part of the group Flores de Magon 2, along with MARIA J. GOMEZ (grocery store) and JUANA J. J. (grocery store), and Ms. MANUELA GOMEZ LOPEZ (grocery store). The group hopes, with this loan, to buy merchandise to supply their respective businesses and in that way increase their sales.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CECILIA , tiene 23 años , casada 3 hijos , su esposo trabaja en el campo . Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y además compra pan en una panadería y lo vende en su tienda al menudeo .Forma parte del grupo Flores de Magon 2 , junto con doña MARIA J. GOMEZ (tienda de barrotes ) , JUANA J. J. ( tienda de Abarrotes ) y doña MANUELA GOMEZ LOPEZ ( tienda de barrotes ). Las tres esperan con el préstamo comprar mercadería para abastecer sus respectivos negocios y así aumentar sus ventas .

loans.use: grocery store

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: O. Helene is a dynamic 52-year-old widow. She has 6 children and lives with her family in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. She has been selling used clothes for years and is proud of having been able to pay tuition and school fees for her children. Helene's youngest daughter will enroll in grammar school in September so she needs to increase her income in order to handle the increased household and education expenses. She wants to increase the volume of her business and she would like to be a used clothes wholesaler in order to improve her profit margin. Helene is honest and has reimbursed all her previous loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes

loans.name: Djimo

texts.en:
Djimo N. is 26 years old. She sells cosmetics and lives in Koumassi, a township in the south of Abidjan. Djimo has had a cosmetics shop in the Koumassi open-air market for 6 years, ever since she had to leave school when her parents were not able to pay for her higher education fees. She is presently working on a computer science diploma in evening courses that she pays for from her cosmetics business.

Djimo wants to expand her business and hopes to be able to move to a bigger shop in order to offer a wider range of products. Dynamic and ambitious, Djimo is a good performer and has been able to reimburse the previous loans she has received from AE&I.

loans.use: purchase a stock of cosmetics products

loans.name: Raihona

texts.ru:
Raihona lives with her husband and their 4 children in Lakkon village. Her husband has no permanent employment and does odd jobs. To help him provide for the family 4 years ago Raihona decided to start selling children's clothing and footwear. Profits from this business help with many expenses for the kids and other family needs. Raihona has no permanent trading place. She travels to the neighboring villages to sell her goods. Previously her husband took out a loan from Microinvest and used it to buy, process and dry apricots. Dried apricots were sold with good profits. Raihona is applying for another loan to farther expand her business.

Translated from Russian by [Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Райхона живет со своим мужем и с детьми в кишлаке Лаккон. Ее муж работает разнорабочим и постоянного места работы у него нет. У Райхоны 4 детей. Чтобы поддержать мужа Райхона 4 года назад решила заняться бизнесом. В качестве товара для продажи она выбрала детскую одежду и обувь. Прибыль от бизнеса помогает решить проблемы семьи, совершаются многие расходы на детей. Постоянного места для торговли нет и она ездит по окрестным кишлакам. В Микроинвест первый займ получил ее муж и он был потрачен на переработку и сушку абрикосов. Переработанный абрикос продали и получили хорошую прибыль. Далее Райхона решила взять займ на расширение своего бизнеса. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine T. L. is a single 23-year-old lady. She lives in Yogougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Sandrine sells various vegetables in the Yopougon open-air market. Very dynamic and ambitious, she wants to expand her business and improve her profit margin. She joined AE&I microcredit program in 2005 and has been a good performer. Sandrine wants to develop her business and then hopes to be able to open a grocery store.

loans.use: Sandrine Tre Lou will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is from Nicolaev, Ukraine. She is divorced and has two grown daughters. Ludmila has requested a loan to increase the assortment of inventory she has available in her small clothing business. She has been in business for nine years. Her business currently has two sales locations – one is in a good location in the lobby of a popular, large supermarket store and the other is a traditional kiosk at one of the local markets. As a single mother, her business is a very important source of income for Ludmila. In addition to meeting her own needs, she’d also like to help one of her daughter purchase an apartment. This loan will allow Ludmila to re-supply her inventory so that she can continue to attract new customers and generate a good profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory in clothing business

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en: Alexei is a taxi driver who assists grateful passengers with their transportation needs in the Ivano-Frankivsk region of western Ukraine. Ivano-Frankivsk is a large city close to the beautiful Carpathian mountain range. During both the summer and winter seasons, it is a popular stop for tourists who come to relax, see the scenery, or enjoy the great outdoors. Alexei has been in business for himself as a taxi driver for nine years. Prior to that, he worked in a different capacity as a driver. Alexei has requested a loan to help him with some taxi repairs. He’d like to have a tune-up on his car and have it re-painted. Alexei is grateful for the financial help he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this additional opportunity to help him sustain his livelihood.

loans.use: Work done on taxi - tune-up and re-paint

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Zahoulou Alphonsine is 44 years old, a single mother, and lives with her 4 children in Yopugon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Alphonsine  sells fruits and vegetables in the Yopougon open market. This business is the sole resource from which she provides for the household and education expenses of her family. She wants to purchase goods in bulk to benefit from lower prices and improve her margin. She has been a very good performer since she joined the AE&I microcredit program two years ago.

loans.use: Zahoulou Alphonsine will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina owns her home and lives there with two daughters on Simeón Roncal Street in the area of Alto San Pedro in La Paz, Bolivia. She is 48 years old and teaches in a primary school in the afternoons and in the evenings, she is busy making masitas (bread), biscochos, and empanadas. Her daughters help her to supplement their income, for she is a single mother. The loan would be to buy more baking materials in bulk since up till now, she has bought them by pound, which is more expensive and reduces her profits as well.

This is her first time with IMPRO but her wish to increase her sales qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Regina vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas en la calle Simeón Roncal de la zona de Alto san Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 48 años de edad, es profesora de primaria durante la tarde y por las noches se dedica a la elaboración de masitas, como ser pan, biscochos, empanadas, queques con ayuda de sus hijas, para mejorar sus ingresos ya que es madre soltera. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material en cantidad ya que a la fecha ella compra solo por libras lo cual hace que sus costos sean un poco altos y su ganancia se vea reducida por esta situación.

No tiene antecedente con IMPRO, pero su deseo de mejorar sus ingresos la califica para acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To buy raw material

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
L. Madeleine is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. She has more than 16 years of work experience in selling food products. Her husband is a mechanic. She lives with her family in Yopougon (a northern suburb of Abidjan).

Madeleine is dynamic and wants to expand her activities and open a grocery store in Yopougon. She heard about AE&I in March, 2005 from her friend and joined the AE&I microcredit program then. She has been a good performer and has always reimbursed all her loans in good manner.

loans.use: Lou Madeleine will use the loan to purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Esmel

texts.en: Esmel A. is a divorced woman. She is 37 years old and has 4 children. She lives with her children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She sells cassava paste and grilled fish in the Yopougon open market. She provides for her children's education and household expenses from her micro business. She is dynamic and courageous. She wants to expand her activities in food cooking and grilled  meat. She is a good performer and has always reimbursed her loans in good manner.

loans.use: Esmel Adel will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines lives with her husband and four children in their own home since December 14 in the high altitude area of Llojeta in La Paz, Bolivia. Her husband works as a taxi driver and brings home 50 Bolivian pesos. With their savings, they bought some wool of a camelid and alpaca (like llamas). Ines started to spin the wool into blankets and would like to offer them for sale. She is looking for a good market to sell her products. Currently, she has orders for her blanket; she spins wool (converting the wool into fine thread) and has another helper that ultimately weaves it into a blanket. Ines brings it to a finish with braids and other designs, ready to be weaved. The loan she is looking is to buy more wool so she can rely on this occupation.

This is her first time with IMPRO but her business potential leads us to believe that Ines needs an opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en la calle desde 14 de diciembre de la zona de alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja con un taxi llevando a su casa una renta de 50 Bs. Con sus ahorros compraron lana de vicuña y alpaca e Ines empezó a hilar y se animo a ofrecer mantas, hallando un buen mercado para sus productos. Actualmente ella realiza mantas a pedido; ella hila (es el proceso de convertir la lana en hilo fino) y tiene otra persona que teje la manta. Ines le entrega el acabado fino con trencilla y otros, listo para el proceso del tejido. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más lana y poder seguir con su actividad.

No tiene antecedente con IMPRO, pero su buena disposición para con su negocio nos llevan a creer que Ines necesita una oportunidad.

loans.use: To buy more raw material

payments.comment: Ines wants to pay her loan off earlier. She will apply for a new loan very soon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his workshop and continue buying raw materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
My name is Victoria Carrazan. I have had a store for 4 years from which I provide for myself and my family. I have good clientele, some of whom include neighbors from the community. I now need to make additional purchases in order to be able to provide better services now that I have a higher demand for various products. My goal is to make my store larger in order to be able to have a better income and better sales.

Translated from to English by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

Mi nombre es Victoria Carrazan, yo tengo una pulperia hace 4 años. el cual es mi sustento de vida para familia. Tengo buenos clientes los cules son tambien mis vecinos de toda la comunidad. ahora necesito hacer varias compra para poder dar un mejor servicio ya que tengo mucha demanda de varios productos, Tengo de meta hacer mas grande mi pulperia para poder tener mejores ingresos y tener mejores ventas.

loans.use: To buy bread, milk, juice, beans, sugar, soap, noodles etc.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
I have a lingerie business in my house and I would like in invest in the purchase of more products in order to have higher sales. This is the only source of income that I have as I am a widow and have one daughter who helps me. I am asking for $1,000 dollars to buy more products for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

Tengo un negocio de productos de lencería en mi vivienda y me gustaría invertir en la compra de más productos para tener mejores ventas, este es la única fuente de ingresos ya que soy viuda y tengo una hija que también me ayuda”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar más productos para mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more products

loans.name: Yeni Rosibel

texts.es:
I have dedicated myself to the production and sale of cotton candy and now also to the sale of french fries. I have had this business for 4 years; I rely on help from my children in order to sell these products as I am a single mother. My clients are really good as I am located in the central park in my town where many children come in the afternoon to play and buy from me. Thanks to your help I was able to add cheese fries to the list of products that I am able to sell. However, I now need to buy more products in order to be able to sell them this month.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

Me dedico a la produccion y venta de algodones de azucar y ahora tambien a la venta de papas fritas. este negocio lo tengo hace 4 años, cuento con la ayuda de mis hijos para venta de estos productos ya que soy madres soltera. Mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en el parque central de mi pueblo, donde muchos niños vienen ajugar todas las tardes y me compran. gracias a ustes por su ayuda pude poner este negocio tambien de la venta de paas firtas con queso. Pero ahora necesito comprar mas producto para poder vender este mes.

loans.use: Purchase sweets, potatoes, oil and gas

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
I have a grocery business out of my house. I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and to have a wider variety of products. Additionally, my wife and I make sausage and we distribute it to other grocers. We work very hard to have a better quality of life. I am asking for $600.00 dollars to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

“Tengo un negocio de abarrotes en mi vivienda, me gustaría invertir en la compra de más mercancía y tener más variedad de productos, también hacemos chorizo entre mi esposa y yo y lo repartimos a otros negocios de abarrotes, trabajamos muy duro para tener una mejor calidad de vida”. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Yenis Margot

texts.en:
My name is Yenis F. and I sell meats and seafood at a market in my village. I've had this business for 5 years and it has enabled me to feed my 4 children. I am requesting this loan so I can purchase more meats and seafood to sell. Thank you for your help; this loan will help me provide better service and increase my sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yenis F., me dedico a la venta de carne y mariscos en un mercado de mi pueblo. Este negocio lo tengo hace 5 años el cual me ayudado mucho para alimentar a mi familia ya que tengo 4 hijos.Ahora necesito comprar mas carnes y marisco ya que en este mes no tengo mucha varieda de carnes. Les agradesecere me puedan ayudar para poder dar un mejor servicio y tener mas ventas.

loans.use: To purchase meats and seafood

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.en: Nancy owns a very unique business in Ayacucho, Peru, a vegetarian restaurant.  She opened the restaurant over seven years ago in hopes that locals would enjoy the new style of food.  Nancy has been a vegetarian for nine years and thinks it is a healthy way of life.  “Carne D. soya” or soy meat was not a popular choice at first, but recently many customers have caught on to the delicious and nutritious meals.  The restaurant serves traditional Peruvian food, with the exchange of soy for meat.  She has six children, two of whom live with her and four of whom are on their own.  Nancy has been a loyal member of FINCA for 4 years and hopes to receive a next loan of $500 to purchase more tables and chairs to seat and serve her increasing number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Business Description

Emma sells food items and sundries from a small shop located on a main street. She also sells sweets at a local school.

Loan Use

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices, which will allow Emma to offer lower prices and increase her profits.

Personal Information

Emma is 55 years old; she lives in a house made of reeds. Her goals are to build a better home and to secure a more stable life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Doña Emma se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y víveres en general. Además su tienda esta muy bien ubicada en calle principal. Además ella vende confitería en una escuela del sector.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor y asi tener mayores ganancias y además poder ofrecer los productos con precios mas económicos.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 55 años y su casa es de caña sus metas son de construir su vivienda y además de asegurarse una vida estable

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Decina Vicenta

texts.en:
Decina’s kiosk is one of the most popular businesses in the market. She sells ‘abarrotes’, also known as packings or cooking supplies. Store owners, restaurant owners, women, men, and children all purchase goods from Decina’s business. Daily clients visit her stand with a smile knowing that Decina sells products of good quality and fair prices. Seven days a week from 7am to 9pm surrounded by bags of split peas, dried corn, flour, eggs, rice, pastas, beans, seasonings, and more, Decina rarely has a break. These are the staple goods of every Peruvian home. Though, Decina says that the most common purchases are rice, noodles, and sugar.

Decina says that her stand has been busy every day for the past seven years that she has owned it. Many women ask for unique products, but with no extra help, she has not been able to fulfill their needs. She is not married and her two children are in school. Decina is asking for a next loan of $500 to maintain her bustling business and keep her clients satisfied.

Decina belongs to a village bank called “Agua Viva”, which means Live Water, where she has friends like her, with a business and who need a loan. For example her friends Patty Reymundez and Felomina Micuylla are also in her village bank and the three women together are expecting a total loan of US$ 1,100.

loans.use: Decina is asking for a next loan of $500 to maintain her bustling business and keep her clients satisfied.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Modesto G. G.. I make my living selling cattle. I have good clients, including some from outside of my town. I have four children, and I am able to educate them thanks to my business, which is our only means of income. Now I need to purchase more calves because I have orders to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola, mi nombre es Modesto G. G. me dedico a la venta de Bovinos (terneros). Tengo muy buenos clientes ya que le vendo a otras personas fuera de mi pueblo. Tengo 4 hijos los cuales estan estudiando con este negocio yo les he podido dar sus estudios ya que este este negocio tengo es el unico ingreso que tengo. ahora nesecito hacer mas compras de Bovinos porque tengo algunos pedidos.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has lived her whole life in the presence of fish. Her father was a fisherman, and caught trout in the local rivers near Trujillo, Peru, where she grew up. When she turned 20 years old, Maria opened a small “cevicheria,” adjacent to her home, and served the trout, cooked without heat by marinating the meat in limejuice. Seven years ago, her husband abandoned her for another woman, and Maria was left to care for her 3 children alone.

Deciding to make a fresh start, Maria moved to Ayacucho, Peru, where she had distant relatives. She used her savings to rent a counter section at the central market, where she sells her ceviche and sodas to up to 50 customers a day. She can be found at her stall, which is equipped with a sink and preparation area, 7 days a week, from about 9 am until quite late at night, or until her supply of fish runs out. Dressed in the traditional white chef hat and apron, Maria exudes experience and professionalism. A steady stream of customers visits her kiosk, and business really picks up during the lunch hour. She serves a generous portion of the diced fish, with potatoes, onions, and a lettuce garnish.

For her next loan, Maria hopes to receive US$500. For now, her stall is modestly equipped with the most basic utilities. She would use the money from this loan for a small refrigeration device that she could install under the preparation counter. For now, Maria must store the fish, which comes frozen twice a week from Lima, at her home, and prepare the ceviche there as well.
