Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine

loans.name: Ivanese

texts.en:
Ivanese D. is a proud mother and business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. Operating her business out of her home, Ivanese sells a variety of essential cosmetic and hygienic supplies, such as toothpaste, soap, and hair care products. She will use this first loan to expand her inventory of supplies to better meet the needs of her community. When not tending to her business, the 68-year-old Ivanese enjoys spending time with her husband, Granvil, and her four children.

Note: Ivanese is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of cosmetic and hygienic supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. C. is just twenty years old but has a bright future. She is just one month from finishing her complete high school education and getting a diploma as a bilingual elementary school teacher in her two languages, Ixil and Spanish. Next year she'll be sent to a remote village to teach kids who are getting and education and thus their first chance to break the cycle of poverty here in the Guatemalan mountains.

Rosa's business is weaving – she weaves the traditional women's top called a huipil and also several other items of traditional women's dress. A huipil takes her about two months to weave and will fetch about US$65 in the local market. With this loan, as she has for the last two years, she'll invest in yarn for her weaving.

Rosa lives with her mom in a two-room block house with a good roof. Her two older brothers send money to help with their living expenses, including Rosa's tuition, which has been more than US$12/month for many years.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving

loans.name: Noradin

texts.en:
Noradin G. is a divorced mother of two and a business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. Operating her business out of her home, Noradin sells a variety of different types of clothes, such as shirts, pants, and undergarments. The 29-year-old Noradin will use this first loan to expand her inventory of clothing to better meet the needs of her community.

Note: Noradin is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand her inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. B. weaves traditional Mayan shawls to sell in the Nebaj market. The women use then to stay warm in the cold, dry in the rain, shaded from the sun or as a cargo carrier which is balanced on the women's heads or slung on their backs. The multi-colored wrap will take 3 days to make and she can sell it for one hundred quetzals (13 US dollars). The large ones she makes are for the women to carry babies on their backs.

In her 40 years Maria has had incredible struggles. She was the only one in her family who survived the Guatemalan civil war in the 1980´s. She was left in orphan when she was 12. Her struggle still continues as an adult. She lives far up a muddy path amongst the cornfields above Nebaj. The place she lives is made of miscellaneous pieces of wood and is danger of collapsing in the next major storm. The floors are dirt and she has no doors or windows, no electricity, and the water spigot is up the hill. She does not consider this a house and she would very much like to have a house.

Her husband works in the cornfields and together they have 4 children. The two oldest are in school and the two younger are not yet of school age. Maria did attend school for a couple years when she was young and learned to read and write, but just barely. Her big goal in life is to make sure her children get a good education so they do not have to struggle as she has. With an education perhaps they will have more opportunities to break out of the great poverty she has known for too many years.

With this loan she will buy yarn for her weaving, two pigs, and eight turkeys, all which she will sell in the local market.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving, also 2 pigs and 8 turkeys

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, 36, is married with 3 children; her husband is an agente municipal (municipal employee/policeman, possibly). She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group along with dona Merida Velasco Molina (who sells shoes from catalogs). With the loan, they want to invest in their businesses: Candelaria, in buying merchandise--beans, rice, sugar, milk, pastas and non-perishable foods--and Merida will try to set up a small shoe shop in her house in which she will sell shoes that she will bring from Tuxtla where she can get a wider range of shoes that she can now order from catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

CANDELARIA, tiene 36 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposos trabaja como agente municipal. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1 junto con doña MERIDA VELASCO MOLINA (vende zapatos por catálogos) Ellas con el préstamo esperan invertir Candelaria comprando mercadería como porotos, arroz, azúcar, leche, pastas y alimentos no perecibles, en cambio Mérida intentará Poner en su casa un pequeño local de venta de zapatos los que traerá desde Tuxtla, solicitando mayor cantidad que lo que hoy pide por catálogos.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva, 36, is married with 4 children; her husband is a farmer. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group along with dona Eloina Fonseca Ozuna who also has a grocery store in her house. Both hope to use the loan to reduce the costs of their merchandise by buying stock for their stores in bulk and so increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MINERVA, tiene 36 años, casada tiene 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y ella tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes, pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1 junto doñaELOINA FONSECA OZUNA que también tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. Ambas esperan comprar con el préstamo mercaderías en el mayoreo para rebajar los costos de compra y así abastecer sus negocios y obtener más ganancias.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S., a 38-year-old business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, has overcome the limitation of her illiteracy by operating a meal preparation business. Left single after a previous marriage, Rosemarie supports herself by providing cooked meals -- often comprised of plantains, rice, and locally grown vegetables -- to her community. Her business is adjacent to the main bridge entering town, a prime location in Trou-du-Nord for a business such as hers. Rosemarie will use this first loan to expand her inventory of food and supplies to better meet the needs of her community.

Note: Rosemarie is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of supplies and food.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania, 56, is married with 8 children. Her husband works at growing maize. She has a grocery store in her house and raises chickens. With the loan, she hopes to buy more merchandise to stock her business, as well as more birds which she will raise and sell in the city market, either live or ready for cooking. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

EPIFANIA, es casada tiene 8 hijos y 56 años, su esposo trabaja en la siembra del maíz,Ella tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos, con el préstamo espera comprar mas mercadería para abastecer su negocio y además comprar mas aves, las cuales después de su crianza venderá en el mercado de la ciudad vivas o para consumo alimenticio. Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Del Rosario, 39, is married with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer and she currently works at home selling fruits and vegetables from a small shop where she sells her products to people in the surrounding neighborhood. With the loan, she hopes to plant and harvest her own vegetables. She belongs to the Lourdes 3 group with Mercedes Zuniga Val (clothes sales) and Reyna Fonseca Rodriguez (fruit and vegetable sales). They hope to use the loan to invest, dona Mercedes in a larger inventory of clothes for sale from her house, but also to go out to sell in nearby neighborhoods, and dona Reyna hopes to set up a small shop for selling fruit at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DEL ROSARIO, tiene 39 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y ella vende frutas y verduras en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño local donde vende sus productos a las personas que viven a los alrededores, con el préstamo espera sembrar y cosechar sus propias verduras . Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 3 junto con: MERCEDES ZUÑIGA VAL (vende ropa) y REYNA FONSECA RODRIGUEZ (vende frutas y erduras) .Ellas esperan con el préstamo invertir doña Mercedes en mayor cantidad de ropa para tener en su casa y además salir a vender a las comunidades cercanas y doña Reyna espera instalar un pequeño localcito de venta de las frutas en su casa.

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria Gloria, 35, is married with 3 children. Her husband works in the fields growing maize. She has a small grocery store in her house where people in the neighborhood come to shop. She belongs to the Lourdes 3 group along with dona Adela Diaz Zuniga (sales of licores, a fruit- and sugar-based drink). With the loan, dona Maria Gloria will buy more merchandise to better stock her store and dona Adela hopes to buy kitchen equipment so that she can improve how she prepares the licores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA GLORIA, tiene 35 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes donde compran las gentes de la comunidad. Ella pertenece al grupo Lourdes 3 junto con doña ADELA DIAZ ZUÑIGA ( venta de licores de fruta y caña ). Con el préstamo doña María Gloria comprara mas mercadería para abastecer mejor su local y doña Adela espera comprar implementos de cocina para preparar en mejores condiciones sus jugos.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es:
Dora Maria, 43, is married with 4 children. Her husband is an employee of a commercial store in the city and she works at home selling clothes and bottled drinks to people in the neighborhood. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Alicia Rosalina Rodriguez G. (fruit and vegetable sales). Both hope to use the loan to increase their sales by acquiring more merchandise for stocking their businesses and by approving the look of the place where they sell their products a bit.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

DORA MARIA, tiene 43 años, casada, 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja contratado como comerciante en un local de la ciudad, ella vende en su casa ropa y refrescos a las personas de su alrededor. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doña ALICIA ROSALINA RODRIGUEZ G. (vende frutas y verduras) Ambas esperan con el préstamo incrementar sus ventas adquiriendo mas mercaderías para abastecer sus negocios y hermosear un poco el lugar donde venden sus productos.

loans.use: Bottled drink sales.

loans.name: Hiris  Cristal

texts.es:
Hiris, 25, is married with one child. Her husband is a musician with a group that plays at various places that hire them. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Engracia Gomez L. (grocery store). Both hope to combine their loans to buy stocks of groceries for their stores and, consequently, have more to offer their customers in the communites where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

HIRIS, está casada tiene un hijo y su edad es de 25 años, su esposo es músico y toca junto a un grupo en lugares donde los solicitan, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doña ENGRACIA GOMEZ L. (tienda de abarrotes). Ambas esperan juntar sus préstamos y comprar mercadería de abarrotes para surtir sus tiendas y así tener más surtido que ofrecerles a sus clientas de la comunidad donde viven.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has a grocery store in her home. She's 34 years old and married. Her husband is a driver at the public transportation collective and they have two children. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Lucia Hernandez Gonzalez (grocery store). They want to go to a wholesaler where they can buy merchandise in bulk so that they can lower their costs which, in turn, will allow them to stock their stores with more goods and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, es casada tiene 34 años, su esposo trabaja como chofer de la locomoción colectiva tienen 2 hijos, ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doña LUCIA HERNANDEZ GONZALEZ (tienda de abarrotes) .Ellas esperan ir a un lugar donde venden las mercaderías al mayoreo y de esta forma rebajar sus costos de compra y lograr abastecer sus locales con mayor cantidad de productos y lograr de esta forma mas ventas.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana raises pigs at her house and then sells them for consumption. She's 40 years old and married with 13 children; her husband is a campesino. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group. She hopes to use the loan to buy more piglets along with feed to fatten them up and, in this way, increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

SEBASTIANA, se dedica a la crianza de puercos en su casa para posteriormente vender para consumo, ella tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 13 hijos, su esposo es campesino. Ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2. Con el préstamo espera comprar más puercos pequeños y también alimento para su engorda y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Pig farming.

loans.name: Liberiana

texts.es:
Liberiana works at home selling bottled drinks to people in the surrounding area. She's 28 years old and married with 4 small children; her husband grows maize. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 3 group along with dona Pascuala de Jesus L. L. (who makes corn tortillas for sale to people in her neighborhood). They hope to use the loan to invest in their respective businesses: Pascuala, buying maize in bulk for her tortillas, and Liberiana, to add a place in her house for selling her bottled drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LIBERIANA, se dedica a la venta de refrescos en su casa para las personas que habitan a su alrededor, tiene 28 años es casada con 4 hijos pequeños, su esposo se dedica a la siembra del maíz, Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 3 junto con doña PASCUALA DE JESUS L. L. (hace tortillas de maíz y las sale a vender entre las personas de su comunidad). Esperan con el préstamo invertir en sus respectivos negocios , Pascuaza comprando maíz por quintales para tener abastecimiento de materia prima para sus tortillas y Liberiana colocar un lugar en su casa para la venta de sus refrescos

loans.use: Bottled drink sales.

loans.name: Ciria Lidia

texts.es:
CIRIA -62 years old- runs a small grocery store at home. She is a widow and has 8 children. She belongs to the group Tres Estrellas 3 (Three Stars 3), along with Ms. DOLORES CASTELLANOS J. (who makes bread at home and sells it door to door). With her share of the loan, Ms. Ciria hopes to stock her store better, buying more groceries and beverages; and Ms. Dolores will buy a hundredweight of flour to scale up her bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

CIRIA, de 62 años de edad, posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Es viuda y tiene 8 hijos. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas, junto con doña DOLORES CASTELLANOS J. (quien prepara pan en su casa y lo comercializa de puerta en puerta). Con su parte del préstamo, doña Ciria espera abastecer mejor su local, comprando más mercadería y bebidas, y doña Dolores comprará un quintal de harina para poder así aumentar la preparación de su pan.

loans.use: Grocery store (Tienda de abarrotes)

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
JUANA buys natural flowers, fruits and vegetables at a nearby city and she then sells them at home to people who live in her neighborhood. She is 54 years old, has 7 children and her husband works as a carpenter at a furniture shop. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas (Three Stars) 6 group, along with Ms. TRINIDAD P. S. (who is dedicated to raising and selling pigs). With the loan, Ms. Juana hopes to install a small shop at home to sell her flowers and fruits, and Ms. Trinidad will buy more pigs, as well as food and vitamins to maintain her animals disease-free.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA compra en una ciudad cercana al lugar donde vive flores naturales, frutas y verduras, y posteriormente las vende en su casa y a las personas que viven cerca de su domicilio. Tiene 54 años, 7 hijos y su esposo trabaja como carpintero en una mueblería. Ella pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 6, junto con doña TRINIDAD P. S. (quien se dedica a la crianza y venta de puercos). Con el préstamo doña Juana espera poder instalar un pequeño local en su casa, donde pueda vender sus flores y frutas, y doña Trinidad comprará más lechoncitos, así como alimento y vitaminas para evitar las plagas entre los animales.

loans.use: Selling flowers, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Porfiria Faustina

texts.es:
Porfiria works at home selling fruits and vegetables that she buys in the city market. She's 36 years old and married with 5 children; her husband grows maize. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 6 group; with the loan, she hopes to renovate the part of her house where she sells her produce so that she can display the fruits and vegetables better and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

PORFIRIA, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa la cual compra en el mercado de la ciudad, es casada tiene 5 hijos y 36 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la siembra del maíz. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 6, con el préstamo espera acondicionar mejor el lugar de su casa donde vende sus productos y así al tener mejor presentación de la fruta y verdura aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, 33, is married with 4 children; her husband works in the fields planting maize. She travels to the city of San Cristobal, two hours away, to buy clothes for children and women to sell from her house to the people in her neighborhood. She belongs to the Lanza 3 group which includes Margarita Cruz Bautista (sales of prepared chicken), Lina Zuniga Vasquez (wholesale bread sales), Bonifacia Molina Coello (who raises pigs). With the loan, all hope to expand their businesses, by buying necessary equipment or supplies to stock their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA, esta casada, tiene 33 años, 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz, ella viaja a la ciudad de San Cristóbal a 2 horas de su casa a comprar ropa para niños y mujeres y luego las vende en su casa entre las gentes de su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Lanza 3 y las otras integrantes son: MARGARITA CRUZ BAUTISTA (venta de pollo trozado), LINA ZUÑIGA VASQUEZ (compra pan por mayoreo en la ciudad y luego lo revende en su comunidad), BONIFACIA MOLINA COELLO (se dedica a la crianza de puercos). Con el préstamo todas esperan incrementar sus negocios comprando ya sea implementos de elaboración o materias primas para abastecer sus negocios..

loans.use: Clothing sales.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean S. is 26 years old, married and lives with her husband and her 1 young child in Siem Reap province, in Cambodia. Mrs S. runs a small laundry shop in her community, while her husband is employed at a private company. Together, they generally earn $5 each day. Eventually, this loan will be used to repair their house, which normally suffers from heavy leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her house

payments.comment: Congratulations to Yean Sarin for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun S. is 31 years old, married and lives in Siem Reap province, in Cambodia. 
She is a housewife and has to take care of her four school-aged children, while her husband works as a Tuk Tuk driver (a passenger cart attached to a motor-bike) and can earn approximately $5/day of income. This loan will be used to purchase a Tuk Tuk and the remainder of the money is to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk and repair their house

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Choeun Sonin start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba has been in business for the last few years. She purchases and re-sells dried fruit, namely apricots. She purchases apricots that are of low quality, takes them home, sorts through them, and then takes the good fruits to the market. She gains profit from the difference in the sales price. Her older daughter helps her at the market.

Matluba is married, she is 43 years old, and she has 5 children. Her husband does not have a job, and sometimes he comes to help her in the market. Matluba must cover all of her family's expenses.

She has been partnering with MicroInvest for the past 2.5 years. She started with a $300 loan and eventually raised the sum to $900. August is the time when dried fruits sell cheaply, and Matluba would like to receive a loan to purchase apricots.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva

Матлуба занимается предпринимательством уже несколько лет. Она занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов, а именно абрикосов. Она покупает низкосортные абрикосы, привозит домой и отсортировав выносит на базар. Полученная разница в цене и есть ее прибыль. На базаре ей помогает ее старшая дочь. Матлуба замужем, ей 43 года и у нее 5 детей. Ее муж нигде не работает, иногда он выходит помочь Матлубе на базаре. Вся тяжесть семейных расходов лежит на Матлубе. С Микроинвест она сотрудничает уже 2,5 года. Начинала кредитоваться с $300, постепенно увеличила сумму до $900. В августе наступает пора когда сухофрукты падают в цене и Матлуба хочет получить займ для закупки абрикосов.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Y. is a 37 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her only child and her mother (both pictured here).  She sells fruit at the local market and earns about $4/day of profit.  With a loan of $1,000, she will be able to purchase more fruit for selling, a business that she knows to be profitable.  In the future, she hopes to continue accessing credit in order to start a small grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Mrs. Theng L. is 51 years old and she works selling snacks in front of a garment factory.  Her husband and their 2 children live with her, but unfortunately her husband is too ill to work.  Their two children help to support their family by working at the garment factory.  This loan will be used by Mrs. Theng L. to purchase more snacks.  She hopes to open a small restaurant selling rice and Khmer food someday.

loans.use: To purchase snacks for her inventory

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Theng Long has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Rajabhon

texts.ru:
Rajabhon is not married, she is 46 years old and does not have children. Rajabhon and her elderly mother live with the brother's family. Her brother has a large family, and to not be a burden on him, Rajabhon trades on the market. She has 8 years of experience purchasing dried fruit on one market, sorting through it, and then reselling quality fruit on another market. Her mother helps her. The financial gain is small, but it helps to cover the costs.

Rajabhon received her first microcredit loan from MicroInvest 2 years ago; she used the money to purchase fresh apricots and dry them with the help of her family. Since then, she has been receiving loans from MicroInvest.

In August, the price for dried fruit is low, and Rajabhon would like to receive a new loan to purchase and store dried fruit. In January and February, when the prices rise, Rajabhon will be able to receive good profit from her sales.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva

Рачабхон незамужем, ей 46 лет и у нее нет детей. Живет она со своей престарелой матерью в семье своего брата. У брата большая семья и, чтобы не быть ему в тягость, Рачабхон выходит на базар торговать. ее опыт работы 8 лет. Рачабхон покупает на одном базаре сухофрукты и отсортировав продает на следующем базаре. Ей помогает ее мать. Прибыль небольшая, но помогает покрывать расходы. В Микроинвест она получила свой первый займ 2 года назад и тогда она приобрела свежий абрикос и высушила его с помощью семьи. С тех пор она получает займы в Микроинвест. В августе цена на сухофрукты падает и Рачабхон хочет получить новый займ для закупки и хранения сухофруктов. В январе и феврале месяце цена на сухофрукты поднимется и тогда продав Рачабхон получить хорошую прибыль.

loans.use: to purchase and store dried fruits

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 6 children.  Mrs. Keo S. works by selling vegetables, and can earn about $3/day.  Her husband is a driver at a private company, while her eldest son is a mechanic.  This loan will be used to provide her son with tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

payments.comment: Congratulations to Keo Sarin for repaying her loan early!

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch I. is 42 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children.  She sells fruit, and earns $6/day, while her husband earns $3/day workI. at a private company.  Three of their children also contribute to the family's income by workI. at a garment factory.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Touch I. to purchase more fruit for sellI..

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

payments.comment: Touch Ing has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru:
Ibodat has a secondary school education and after finishing school she did not work anywhere. Currently she is a businesswoman and sells children’s clothing and shoes. She is married, is 41 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is in Russia earning money and sends money home to support the family.

Ibodat’s oldest daughter needs to get married soon and Ibodat would like to use the profits from her business for her daughter’s dowry. She has been a client of MicroInvest for one year and is an exemplary client. She would like to use the new loan to purchase school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

У Ибодат среднее образование и после окончания школы она нигде не работала. Занимается бизнесом и продает детскую одежду и обувь. Она замужем, ей 41 год и у нее 3 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России и присылает деньги на содержание семьи. У Ибодат старшая дочь, которая скоро должна выйти замуж, и поэтому прибыль от бизнеса она хочет потратить на приданное для дочери. В Микроинвест она кредитуется год и показала себя как образцовый клиент. Новый займ она хочет потратить на закупку школьной формы..

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Shoira has known the trading system since childhood as her father worked in a big store. When Shoira was not able to find a regular, stable job she started selling goods at the market. She is divorced and is raising 2 small children. This year she turned 30.

Shoira sells men’s shoes and every day travels to different markets in kishlaks (villages). MicroInvest loans have helped her to expand the quantity and selection of her products. Shoira plans to use this loan to purchase fall shoes.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоира с детства знает систему торговли так как ее отец работал в большом магазине. Так получилось что не найдя нормальной постоянной работы Шоира стала выходить на базар торговать. Шоира разведена с мужем и воспитывает 2 маленьких детей. В этом году ей исполнилось 30 лет. Шоира продает мужскую обувь, и каждый день с утра она ездит по базарам проходящим по кишлакам. Полученные займы Микроинвест помогли ей расширить количество и ассортимент ее товаров. Очередной займ Шоира собирается потратить на закупку осеннего ассортимента мужской обуви.

loans.use: For purchase of autumn assortment of footwear

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Zarrina works as a nurse in the city hospital in Isfara. Her husband is always sick and cannot work. Zarrina is 42 years old and has 4 children. A nurse’s salary is small and in her free time Zarrina sells goods at the market. She has a small business and sells perfumes. She travels to Khudzhand once a week to purchase products. Despite the small size of the business Zarrina has many regular clients and makes good profits that contribute substantially to the family budget.

Zarrina has been working with MicroInvest for 6 months. She plans to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Заррина работает медицинской сестрой в городской больнице города Исфара. Ее муж постоянно болеет и не имеет возможности работать. Заррине 42 года и у нее 4 несовершеннолетних сыновей. Заработная плата медсестры маленькая и в свободное от работы время Заррина выходит на базар торговать. У нее маленький бизнес и продает она парфюмерную продукцию. За товаром она ездит в Худжанд раз в неделю. Несмотря на маленький бизнес у нее много постоянных клиентов и прибыль остается хорошая. Это вносит существенный вклад в семейный бюджет. С Микроинвест Заррина работает в течении 6 месяцев. С помощью займа Заррина собирается и дальше развивать свой бизнес.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig A. operates a photo-developing studio. He is married with two children. His shop is located in Beylagan, a small town in southern-west Azerbaijan near the Iranian border. He has operated this business since 1995. Rafig develops photos using a large photo-processing machine. He also works as a photographer at weddings.

Rafig has more experience in this business than his competitors. This is his first loan and he plans to remodel his shop and purchase a digital camera. This new camera will allow him to take better photos and increase his business.

loans.use: To repair his shop and purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru:
Shafoat buys and resells apricot pits. In Isfar, there is a tradition to crush the pits and take out the soft core called magz. A lot of local entrepreneurs involved in magz trade. Shafoat buys magz at the nearby markets and then resells it at the central market. Shafoat, 42 has 2 children. Her husband works as a collective farmer. His salary is very small, so he helps Shafoat to sell. The workday starts early in the morning and ends at the lunch time. When the trading day is over, Shafoat and her husband transfer the remaining magz home and sort it there to increase its price. Recently, Shafoat received a loan from MicroInvest and increased the volume of magz that she sells. Shafoat plans to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шафоат занимается куплей продажей абрикосовых косточек. В Исфаре принято раскалывать косточки, и извлеченное ядро называется «магз». Куплей продажей «магз»-а занимается много предпринимателей. Шафоат закупает «магз» по окрестным базарам и продает на центральном рынке. Шафоат 42 года, у нее 2 детей. Ее муж работает простым колхозником. Заработная плата маленькая и он тоже выходит на базар и помогает своей жене. Рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до обеденного времени. После окончания базара Шафоат и ее муж перевозят оставшийся «магз» домой и далее сортируют. Это дополнительно увеличивает цену. Недавно Шафоат получила займ в Микроинвест и увеличила количество «магз»-а. Очередной займ она собирается потратить на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin C. is 27 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  She earns a living renting rooms, a business that earns her $1/day.  Her husband earns $5/day as a policeman, and the couple's combined income is enough to send their children to school.  This loan will be used to purchase a cart to sell sugar cane juice.  Mrs. Kin C. has free time to sell juice, and knows it will be a good way to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to sell sugar cane juice

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Kin Chaivath has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum S. is 50 years old and works as a seamstress in Phnom Penh, earning $1/day.  She lives with her husband, a bodyguard, who earns $4/day, and their 5 children.  Mrs. Soum S. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to help her business, and also to help the family cut down on transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Prek

texts.en: Mrs. Prek A. is a 53 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 5 children.  She works two jobs - selling porridge and raising pigs.  Combined, these businesses earn her $3/day.  She would like to take out a loan in order to purchase more pigs to raise.  When they mature, she can sell them to the market and earn additional income to support her family.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mr. Un T. is 59 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife (pictured here). He works as a traditional Khmer doctor, using herbs and natural subsititutes for healing. This occupation pays him $2/day. He and his wife also operate a small business selling fruit.  This loan will be used to purchase more fruit for selling so he and his wife can improve their lives.

loans.use: Mr. Un Ton would like to purchase fruit for his stand.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S. is 34 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children. She works selling fruit at the market, and earns $2/day. Her husband works as a soldier and also contributes to the family's income. The couple can now send their children to school, but they are still working to increase their incomes. This loan will be used to purchase fruit for selling, and also soft drinks.

loans.use: Touch would like to purchase fruits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng K. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their five children. She works selling bananas and farming the family's land, and can earn about $3/day. Her husband helps with the farming, but they need a better way to water their crops. This loan will be used to purchase a waterpump to increase the yield from their land. In the future, she hopes her husband can handle the farming so she can open a clothing shop at the nearby open air market.

loans.use: Heng would like to purchase a water pump for her farm.

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma S. is a 48 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her five children. She runs a wholesale clothing business that gives her $5/day income. Her eldest children work at private companies, while the younger 2 are still students. Mrs. Ma S. will use this loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: Ma would like to purchase clothes for selling at her small business.

payments.comment: Congratulations! Ma Samang paid back her loan early!

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam B. is 29 years old, an inhabitant of the Tursun-zoda district. He is married and has a secondary education. After school graduation, he worked in small firms as sub–professional staff. Two years ago, he started farming. He is planting potatos, tomatoes, peppers, onions, flax and wheat.

Currently he has 5 hectares of land where he is going to plant onions and winter wheat. His brothers and relatives help him in farm. With this loan, Uktam is going to buy onion seed and the rest of loan he will spend for cultivation, planting, petrol and a tractor driver. The client is going to pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other expenditures for onion planting

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika is a single mother. She is raising a daughter. Malica, 46 has high school education. Malica sells women’s shoes. Her daughter sells in a small store at the central market, while Malica travels to sell on the markets nearby. Two years ago, when Malica received her first loan to expand her business, she did not own the store. Gradually growing the business, Malica opened the small store. Today, Malica continues to collaborate with MicroInvest. She asks for another loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Малика незамужем и воспитывает дочь. Ей 46 лет, образование среднее. Занимается Малика продажей женской обуви. На центральном рынке у Малики есть маленький магазин, где торгует ее дочь, а она сама ездит торговать по окрестным рынкам. 2 года назад она получила свой первый займ для расширения бизнеса. Тогда у нее еще не было магазина. Постепенно расширяя свой бизнес Малика смогла открыть магазин. Малика и сейчас активно сотрудничает с Микроинвест и просит займ для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Mrs. Chun S. is a 47 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her only child. She rents out rooms in her home, and her daughter helps support her by working at a garment factory. This loan will be used to repair her home so she can continue to rent out rooms.

loans.use: Chun would like to repair her house so she can rent out a room

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Chun Sambun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children. She earns a living selling fruit, while her husband works as a security guard. The couple earns $6/day, but they are also helped by their two children that work as security guards just like their father. This loan will be used for Mrs. Sum S. to purchase more fruit so she can expand her business.

loans.use: Sum would like to purchase fruit to sell.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sum Som has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mr. Sou S., 48 years old, and his wife (pictured here) live and work together in Phnom Penh Cambodia. They produce and sell brooms, and can earn $8/day in this business. They have five children, two of whom work at a garment factory, and three of whom are students. This loan will be used for the couple to purchase more materials so they can continue in their broom business. They earn good income from selling brooms, and they hope to continue accessing credit to expand their business in the future.

loans.use: Sou would like to buy more brooms to sell.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sou Samuo start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Munira has been a MicroInvest client for more than 2 years. Over this time, big changes happened in her life. In the past, Munira had no house of her own. Since she started her business, by putting aside a fraction of the profits, Munira was able to buy a parcel of land and begin a house construction. Munira, 35 is married and has 3 children. Her husband has no permanent job and puts all his efforts to help her wife in her challenging business. Munira buys dried apricots and pit. She and her family then sort the purchases and re-sell them based on the sorted grades. With help of MicroInvest loans, Munira significantly increased the asset value of her business. Following Munira’s advice, many other women, who sell dried fruits, became MicroInvest borrowers. Now, Munira asks for a new loan to purchase dried fruits.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Более 2 лет Мунира является клиентом Микроинвест. За это время в ее жизни произошли большие изменения. Раньше у нее не было своего собственного дома. Занимаясь бизнесом и откладывая прибыль она смогла купить участок земли и начала постройку дома. Мунире 35 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. У ее мужа нету постоянной работы и он всеми силами старается помочь своей жене в ее нелегком бизнесе. Мунира покупает сушеный абрикос и его косточки, она и ее семья сортируют купленное и затем продают по сортам. С помощью займов Микроинвест Мунира значительно увеличила активы своего бизнеса, следуя ее совету, многие женщины, торгующие сухофруктами, пришли в Микроинвест и получили займы. Сейчас она просит новый займ для закупки сухофруктов.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricot and pit

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin M. is 46 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their child. She works selling brooms, a good business that gives her $20/day in revenue. Her husband helps with the broom business, but also works renting rooms to garment factory workers. This loan will be used for Mrs. Yin M. to purchase more brooms for her inventory.

loans.use: Yin would like to purchase brooms to sell.

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. Thun M. is 59 years old and lives with her husband and their child in Phnom Penh. She works both selling brooms and renting rooms of the family's home. Her husband helps with renting rooms, and their family income is around $8/day. This loan will be used for Mrs. Thun M. to repair her home so they can continue renting out rooms. She hopes to continue with this business in the future because affordable room rentals are in high demand in Cambodia.

loans.use: Thun would like to repair her home for renting out rooms.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mr. Suon C. is 62 years old and married with two children. He and his family live in Phnom Penh and earn a living by renting rooms. His wife (pictured here with one of their grandchildren) also works as a seamstress and earns $2/day. This loan will be used for the family to build more rooms that they can rent out monthly. With this loan, they will be able to increase their income now, and also provide their children with a good business in the future.

loans.use: Suon would like to build more rooms for renting out.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Suon Chuon start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mr. So R., his wife, and their four children live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The couple sells brooms for a living, and can earn about $8 per day. This income is just enough to put their four children through school. This loan will be used for Mr. So R. to purchase more brooms for selling. He would like to continue stocking brooms so their business can grow in the future.

loans.use: So would like to purchase brooms to sell.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mr. Phen C. is 59 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their two children. He works producing and selling brooms, a business that gives him $8 per day. His wife is a landlord, and can earn about $2/day. Mr. Phen would like this loan so he can buy bulks of grass that will eventually be made into brooms. His business is succesful now, and with access to this loan, he will be able to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: Phen would like to puchase bulks of grass to produce brooms to sell.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Phen Choeun start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She sells used clothes. She began her business in 2004, and has been in LAPO for two years. She would like a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena N. is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a business center where she types and photocopies documents for clients. She would like a loan to purchase a computer and scanner, as well as a Photostatting machine and printer.

loans.use: To buy computer, scanner & printer.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru:
Ozoda buys and resells clothing for children. She is 34, married, and has 3 little children. Ozoda has no other job and her small business is her main source of income, because her husband is also unemployed. Over the six months of being a MicroInvest borrower, Ozoda’s business has shown noticeable improvements. The sales volume increased and the assortment of the goods expanded. Ozoda asks for the new loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Озода занимается куплей продажей детской одежды. Она замужем, ей 34 года и у нее 3 маленьких детей. Озода нигде не работает и торговля является для нее основным источником дохода, так как ее муж тоже нигде не работает. Уже полгода Озода получает займы в Микроинвест и за это время в ее бизнесе произошли изменения в лучшую сторону. Увеличился объем бизнеса, улучшен ассортимент товаров. Новый займ просит для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса.

loans.use: for further expansion of business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella O. is 42 years old, happily married, and has five children. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She lives with her family in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She would like a loan to purchase additional crates of drinks and ingredients for her soups.

loans.use: To buy crates of drinks & wines

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba’s husband, just like many other men in the region, is working as a seasonal laborer in Russia. He sends some money, but the transfers are catastrophically low to pay for his family’s necessities, while life is getting more expansive every day. To make ends meet, Matluba sells clothing for children and light fabrics at nearby markets. Matluba, 30 is a mother of 2 children. Her business pays for most of her family expanses. A year ago, Matluba heard of MicroInvest and came for her first loan. According to her, the loan gave her business a boost and brought additional income. A season of strong sales is approaching and Matluba wants to receive a new loan to buy school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муж Матлубы как и многие мужчины ее региона находится на заработках в России. Он присылает деньги для содержания семьи, но их катастрофически не хватает, тем более жизнь дорожает с каждым днем. Матлуба занимается предпринимательством и продает детскую одежду и легкие ткани. Торгует она по окрестным базарам. Матлубе 30 лет и у нее 2 детей. За счет бизнеса она покрывает большую часть своих семейных расходов. Услышав и Микроинвест она пришла и получила первый займ год назад. По ее словам это дало толчок для развития бизнеса и дало дополнительную прибыль. Скоро наступает сезон хорошей торговли и она хочет получить новый займ для закупки школьной одежды.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for four years. She would like a loan to purchase more crates of drinks and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest on her business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda has big family. She has 4 children and her husband's salary is not enough to support the family. Mavjuda has been engaged in trade for over 14 years. Her business is sewing oriental robes and selling them in the market. This is their family business, a tradition that has been transmitted from mothers to children. Since childhood, Mavjuda and her sisters helped their mother sew robes for the market.

Now her mother is an old woman and Mavjuda and her elder sister sell robes in the market. Their trade place is located in Jumabazaar, a big clothing market in Khujand. Now the turnover of her business is fast and she has many clients. She wants purchase fabric for the next batch of robes. She is requesting $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make robes

loans.name: Cecelien

texts.en: Cecelia E. is married, and has eight children. She is 52 years old, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Cecelia has owned a restaurant for the past six years. She would like a loan to purchase more foods and drinks.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Vohida

texts.en:
Vohida has her own beauty salon. She has been engaged in this business since 1995. Before, she taught mathematics in school for 15 years She loved her work, but her salary was not enough for her family’s needs.

She rented the second floor of a little shop for her beauty salon. Today she has many clients and her business is going well. In the future, she wants to open a wedding salon near her beauty salon. She has free room for this purpose. She has also ordered wedding dresses from her friend from Dubai. She needs in $600 for purchasing mannequins for her wedding salon.

loans.use: Purchase of mannequins for wedding salon

loans.name: Munojot

texts.ru:
Munojot, 35 is married and has 3 children. She has been selling on a market for 6 years. The goods that she sells include clothing for children, socks for men and women, and other small items. Munjot’s children are small and Munjot’s mother-in-law takes care of them. Munjot buys and delivers her goods from a wholesaler in Istaravshan. Munjot does not have a permanent trading spot, so she has to sell wherever she can find a place. Her husband sends money from Russia, where he works as a seasonal laborer. Munjot became a MicroInvest borrower a year and a half ago. Then, her business assets were about $450. By now, Munjot more than doubled the value of her business. Munjot hopes to use the new loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муночот 35 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. В течении 6 лет она выходит на базар торговать. Ассортимент ее товаров составляет детская одежда, мужские и женские носки и другая мелочевка. Дети Муночот маленькие и за ними следит дома ее теща. За товаром Муночот ездит на оптовый рынок в г. Истаравшан. У нее нет постоянного места для торговли и она торгует где придется. Ее муж находится в России и присылает деньги. В Микроинвест она начала кредитоваться 1,5 года назад. Тогда объем ее бизнеса составлял примерно $450. Сейчас он увеличился более чем в 2 раза. Новый займ она собирается потратить на увеличение объема продаваемых товаров.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Odion

texts.en: Mrs. Odion A. is 36. Married with three children, she hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells blocks of ice, provisions, and drinks. Odion is requesting a loan of $400 to buy an ice-making machine. She is optimistic that this machine can improve her business and allow her to better care for her family.

loans.use: To buy a machine to make ice blocks

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche O. is married with four children. She is 32 years of age and hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 4 years. She sells provisions and is requesting a loan of $325 so that she can further expand her micro-business. Uche is hard-working and has about 4 years' experience in running her little grocery store.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her little grocery store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Ogbonaye is married with four children. She is 35 years of age and  hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. Mercy sells provisions at the open-air market and needs a loan of $400 to expand the inventory of her micro-business.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her market stall

loans.name: Okoye

texts.en: Okeke N. is 26 years old, unmarried, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a hair stylist and needs a loan of $250 for the purchase of a hair dryer and hair relaxer, hair cream, hair extensions, etc. With the above loan, Okeke is optimistic that her business will improve.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment i.e., dryers etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: "I'm requesting a loan of $400 to invest in soft drinks and my yam business," says Mrs. Rachael E. who lives in Oguosa, Benin City. She is married with 3 children. Racheal is 48 years old and has 10 years' experience in her micro-business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba and her husband make a living by preparing and selling shish kebab. They have been doing this for 4 years. They have no other permanent jobs and their business is the only source of income. Mahbuba and her husband travel among all markets in the region, so they have to work every day of the week. Selling at a single market brings them $150-200 in earnings. Mahbuba became a MicroInvest client 6 months ago. Now, she plans to take another loan to increase the volume of goods sold. The Juraevs are on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махбуба и ее муж занимаются изготовлением и продажей шашлыка. Опыт в этой деятельности 4 года. Постоянной работы нету и бизнес является основным источником семейного дохода. Для их бизнеса каждый день является рабочим, так как они посещают все базары региона. За один базар реализуют шашлыка на $150-200. Клиентом Микроинвест Махбуба стала 6 месяцев назад. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для увеличения товарооборота. На фото Вы видите супругов Джураевых.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia E. sells kitchen utensils and sewing materials. She needs additional funds to boost her business. Felicia lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, with her five children. She is 53 years old. She became a LAPO member 2 years ago.

loans.use: To improve my micro-business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: "I hope to buy a refrigerator to enable me sell cooled drinks and  water," says Mrs. Susan E., who lives in Ofumwengbe in Benin City. She is married with 3 children and is 35 years old. She has 3 years' experience in running her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fridge and provisions

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: "I learnt how to run a grocery store and sell provisions from my mother. I hope to buy more drinks and provisions to expand my inventory," says Mrs. Doris A.. She is 41 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Ewakpe Lane in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Doris started her business last year.

loans.use: Purchase of generator and provisions

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO client." says Miss Blessing E., who lives in Obasuayi, Benin City. She styles hair and sells "weavons" (hair extensions). She is 27 years of age and has 3 years' experience in her business. Blessing hopes to buy more "weavons" and other hairdressing equipment for her little salon.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions etc. for her hairdressing business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Mrs. Rebecca I. is 32 years old, married, with 2 children. She lives in an urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. "I'm requesting a loan of $400 to invest in my timber business," says Rebecca. She has 4 years' experience in her business and has also been a member of LAPO for four years.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 45 years old and hails from Asaba in Delta State. She sells soft drinks (mineral water, Malta, etc.) and cooked food to her community. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a deep freeze and more goods for sale. Rose has been a LAPO client for 5 years.

loans.use: To invest in her little restaurant

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. is 43 years old. She is a native of Iselu-Uku in Delta State. She sells soft drinks (mineral water, Malta, etc.) and cooked food to her community. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more goods for sale. Veronica has 7 years' experience in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food items for sale

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia A. is 50 years old. She is a mother of three children and has been a member of LAPO since 2001. She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to expand her micro-business, a little restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Mr. Paul E. is a farmer who specializes in the production of fish and turkeys for sale to his community. He is 52 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Paul needs a loan of $1,175 to buy more fingerlings and feed for the fish he farms. He has been in the farming business since 1994.

loans.use: To buy more fingerlings (little fish) to raise and fish feed

loans.name: Nkem

texts.en: Nkem N. is 55 years old and is the mother of 8 children. She is from Okpanemu town in Delta State. She learnt the business of selling provisions and soft drinks from her mother. Nkem needs a loan of $625 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in drinks and provisions for resale

loans.name: Aneen

texts.en: Aneen N. is 47 years old and a native of Okpanamua town in Delta State. She specializes in the preparation and sale of local dishes in her little restaurant. Aneen is the mother of four children. She is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for preparing foodstuffs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 36 years old. A native of Okpanamu, a town in Delta State, she is the leader of a LAPO group.  She has 2 years' experience in her business, i.e., in the sales and rental of video CDs. Mary is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase more CDs and expand her little micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs for her inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine O. specializes in the sale of provisions and foodstuffs. She is 56 years old, mother of eight children. She has been running a little grocery store for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a wider range of goods for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store

loans.name: Nwanbuoku

texts.en: Mrs. Nwanbuoku C. is 40 years old. She is happily married with six children. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more goods for sale in her little grocery store. She has 3 years' experience in her business and has been a member of LAPO for three years as well.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell in her little grocery store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary A. is 40 years old and is happily married with eight children. She lives in Ezenchi in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks, dried fish, and provisions. Mary is requesting a loan of $400 for the purchase of provisions and other foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store. She started this business last year.

loans.use: To buy provisions & food items for sale

loans.name: Beatrices

texts.en: "I am proud to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member," says A. Beatrice, who is married. She is 27 years old and lives on Cowan Street in Asaba, Delta state. She sells weavon, hair cream, and relaxer. She also fixes hair, and does pedicures & manicures. "I hope to buy more weavon, hair cream and relaxer," says Mrs. A. Beatrice. She has been in this business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy weavon, hair cream and relaxer

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: "The sewing of clothes in Asaba is a very good business, as everyone always wears clothes," says Uche E., who lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is married with a child, and is 30 years old. She would like to invest this loan in the purchase of sewing materials and weavon. She has been in this business since 1997.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. is a widow who is 50 years old and has ten children. She is a native of Imo State but resides in Delta State, in Nigeria. She sells drinks, water and provisions to the community. She needs the loan for the growth of her business. She has 5 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and water for sale

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Mrs. Maryam L. Okeya is a business woman who sells fairly used clothes, and also has a hairdressing salon. She is 47 years old and is married with 7 children. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, and wishes to improve her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy fairly used clothes and weavon						cream and relaxer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice L. is married with two children. She has spent 7 years as a Lift Above Poverty Organization member. She sells engine oil and motorcycle tyres to people living in her community. She is requesting the above loan in order to expand her business. She has 8 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle tyres and oil for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther E. is 42 years old and is married with six children. She is requesting the above loan to buy frozen chicken, turkey, provisions & foodstuff for sale. "I am proud to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member for the past eight years, and a union leader," says Esther. She hails from Umuisor, Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuff, frozen chicken and turkey for sales

loans.name: Vegina

texts.en: Vegina E. is 40 years of age, and is married with three children. She started her business in 2004 has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization for eight years. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She specializes in cooked food, and the sale of drinks and water. She is requesting the above loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy drinks, flour & food items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary N. is happily married with a child; she is 40 years of age. She is a native of Aba but resides in Asaba in Delta State, Nigeria. She specializes in the preparation & sale of local food & pepper soup. People living in the area like her food. Hence she is referred to as home food. She also sells drinks. She is requesting the above loan to enable her to purchase a generator & foodstuff. She has eleven years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy a generator & food stuff.

loans.name: Helen Iloba

texts.en: Mrs Helen Iloba O. is 43 years old and is married with three children. She specializes in the sale of provisions, drinks and cooking utensils. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She needs the above loan to buy a deep freezer and more goods for sale, and has been in this business since 2003.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer & more goods for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: "I hope to use this loan for the purchase of a generator, weavon hair cream & relaxer," says Mrs. Florence Chukwuji, who lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old, and is happily married with (4) children. She started this business eight years ago.

loans.use: To buy a generator, weavons hair cream & relaxer.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica A. is a businesswoman who sells provisions and drinks. She is 51 years old, and is married with 4 children. She wishes to buy drinks and provisions with the loan that will be given to her, and she has been in this business since 1986.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for sale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Mrs. Hilda I. started her business 3 years ago and it has helped to take care of her family. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells provision & foodstuff to her community. Mrs. Hilda I. is married with (5) children. She intends to expand her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina L. lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is happy to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member. She is married with five (5) children. She said LAPO has brought rain to her family and she needs the above loan to expand her business. She has 5 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff for sales

loans.name: Benedette

texts.en: "Lift Above Poverty Organization has brought rain to my family," said Mrs. Benedette A., a native of Anambra State, but residing in Asaba, Delta State. She is 32 years old and married with four (4) children. She deals with foodstuffs and she intends to purchase more with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for sales

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Mr. Bosede O. is a young woman of 31 years, and married with 3 children. She is a native of Ekiti State, Nigeria. She specializes in the sale of clothes, shoes and bags. "I need the above amount to expand my business," said Mrs. Bosede, who has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags and shoes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine A. is married with six (6) children, and is 45 years old. She hails from Delta State, Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the above loan to expand her foodstuffs business. She has 25 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is a dedicated client of LAPO, who specializes in the sale of foodstuff, drinks and provisions to her community. She is a native of Ekiti State but resides in Asaba Delta State, Nigeria. She is married with three (3) children, is 40 years old, and wishes to improve her business with the above loan. She has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: "Lift Above Poverty Organization gave me joy and hope in my business and I am very happy to be a LAPO member," says Mrs. Janet S.. She sells ice blocks and renders a laundry service to people in her area. She is 48, has five children, and hails from Asaba, Delta State. She hopes to improve her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy deep freezer and sachet water

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: "I derive joy in knitting caps, cardigans and babywear. I wish to invest the loan that will been given to me, by purchasing knitting materials," said Mrs. E. Francisca. She is 35 years old, married with a child, and a native of Enugu State of Nigeria, but residing in Asaba Delta State. She has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more knitting materials

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Mr Clement O. is 45 years old and has five children. He is from Uromi town in Edo State. He sells and repairs electrical appliances and needs the above loan to expand his business.  He has been in this business since 1985.

loans.use: To expand his electrical appliances business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin Bar is a 40-year-old married man of with four children. He runs a bar and needs an additional deep freezer and chairs. He learned the bar business from his brother and is proud of his business, which he has had since 1999. Mr. Bar would like a loan of $550 to buy a freezer and more chairs for the bar.

loans.use: To buy an additional deep freezer and chairs for his bar

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a 48 year old fashion designer with six children. She is from  Uromi town in Edo State and needs the loan to expand her business.  She has been in this business since 1982 and LAPO has helped her improve it.

loans.use: To buy machine, clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is a 28 year old married woman and is from Uromi of Edo State.  She is a Hair dresser by profession and has studied hair dressing for three years.  She is and has been a LAPO client for 4 years and has been in the hair dressing business for seven years.  She needs the above loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy freezer, weavons and ladies wears

loans.name: Okoduwa

texts.en: Mr. G. Okoduwa is 31 years old and married with one child.  He is an industrious man who has a shop where he sells leather boxes, shoes and bags to the public.  He needs the loan for business expansion and has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy leather boxes, shoes and bags for resale

loans.name: Adolphus

texts.en: Mr. Adolphus I. is 46 years old and married with five (5) children. He is a farmer and has been in this business since 2003.  He needs the loan to expand his poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for his farming business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella J. is 42 years, has four children and lives in Benin City, Edo state. She wholesales and retails drinks. She has been in this business for nine years and a LAPO member for eight years.  She hopes to improve her business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Esohe Azuka

texts.en: Mrs. Esohe Azuka O. is 43 years old, happily married with 4 children. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has been a LAPO member for 5 years. She sells provisions & cosmetics and has been in this business for eight years. She needs the above loan to buy more inventory for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sales.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Mr. Charles U. has been a LAPO member for 5 years.  He lives in Ewa Road, Off Ikpoba Slop, Benin City, Edo State.  He states that LAPO has been a sources of income to his business and has helped improve his business and pay for his three children to go to school.  He hopes to expand his business with the above loan.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Shabani Ally

texts.en:
Shabani is a 33-year-old resident of the Kinondoni area in Central Dar Es Salaam. He has been a technician for aluminum frames for the past five years and has been contracted to design aluminum frames in various offices in Dar es Salaam.

His work is seasonal, so if the contracted work terminates, he looks for another contract immediately. To sustain a living, he has a restaurant at his place where he prepares chips, fried eggs and chicken each evening.

He is in need of US Dollars 1,200 to help him acquire more equipment for his aluminum cutting business so that he can favorably compete and satisfy all his clients.

loans.use: Buying the Aluminium cutting Equipments

loans.name: Ortencia

texts.es:
Ortencia owns a kiosk where she sell sweets in the Plaza 16 de Julio in the city of El Alto. The business allows her to support her entire family, particularly her 4 school age children.

Ortensia has been a Pro Mujer partner for 12 years now. She is a member of the communal association Villazón. Three years ago she started a new business.

At the present time Ortencia is a vendor of wool from the vicuña, an animal similar to the llama. She is principal provider of this fine wool for the Norwegian Mission, an organization that demands a lot of this product.

Right now Ortencia needs capital to be able to increase her stock of merchandise, both for her wool business, to meet the demand she's seeing, and for her sweets kiosk. Her objective with the investment is to prepare both businesses for the holidays at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Es dueña de un Kiosco de dulces en la Plaza 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, negocio que le permitió dar sustento a toda su familia, principalmente a sus 4 hijos, los que se encuentran en edad escolar.

Ortencia T. es socia de Pro Mujer hace ya 12 años, pertenece a la asociación comunal Villazón, y hace tres años dio inicio a un nuevo negocio.

En la actualidad Ortencia es comerciante de lana de vicuña, y principal proveedora de la Misión Noruega, organización de demanda exigente para este producto.

Actualmente Ortencia precisa de inversión de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, tanto para la demanda de lanas de vicuña, como para su kiosco de dulces, todo esto preparando la venta para las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Ortencia needs capital to be able to increase her stock of merchandise, both for her wool business, to meet the demand she's seeing, and for her sweets kiosk. Her objective with the investment is to prepare both businesses for the holidays at the end of the year.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is a 43 year old widow and LAPO union leader who believes LAPO has really helped her business. She lives in Osazua Street in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria with 5 children. She sells items for babies and hopes to improve her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy more baby wares for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio Q., father of 6 children and an artisan shoemaker by profession, has owned a sales stall in the Avenida Circunvalación for 8 years. He has been a Pro Mujer partner for 12 years. He is one of Pro Mujer's longest standing partners, and belongs to the communal association Villazón.

When he first started his business, Antonio worked in the street, covering his stall with a plastic tarp so he could work through inclement weather, all to support his large family.

At the present time Antonio owns a kiosk on the same street, where he is now better able to work.

Despite his success, he needs to inject capital into his business to be able to buy a motorized sander to use in his kiosk. The sander would allow him to meet his client demand and thereby increase his income, which is important now that his children are growing and their needs are greater.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio Q., padre de 6 hijos y de profesión Artesano Zapatero, hace más de 8 años tiene su puesto en la Av. Circunvalación. Socio de Pro Mujer hace más de 12 años, es uno de los más antiguos, y pertenece a la Asociación Comunal Villazón.

En sus inicios, Antonio trabajaba en la calle, instalando una carpa de plástico y expuesto a las inclemencias del tiempo, todo para poder llevar el sustento a su numerosa familia.

Actualmente Antonio es dueño de un Kiosco en la misma avenida, donde puede desarrollar de mejor forma su trabajo.

Pese a todo, el necesita de una inyección de capital para poder adquirir un motor de lijar, para implementar en su kiosco, de esta manera hacer frente a la demanda de los clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y sus necesidades son mayores.

loans.use: He needs capital with which to buy a motorized sander to use in the kiosk where he makes shoes. The sander will allow him to meet client demand and increase his income, which in turn will help him support his 6 growing children.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith O. is 45 years old with (6) children and lives in Siluko Road, Benin City Edo State. She sells provisions, kerosene and food stuff. She needs the above loan to improve her business which she has been in since 2002.  She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more food, provisions & kerosene for resale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista lives in the Sajama area of the city of El Alto with her children and her 9 grandchildren.

She has been a Pro Mujer partner for 5 years. Teresa handcrafts sweaters from wool and then sells her products in the streets of the southern part of the city of La Paz.
