With her first Pro Mujer loan, she was able to increase her inventory, which in turn later allowed her to acquire a sewing machine. The machine has allowed her to substantially increase her income. Currently Teresa is making both wool sweaters and baby's clothing (baby's sweaters/jackets). She needs capital to be able to buy raw materials with which to fulfill existing demand, and at the same time plans to expand the variety of products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista, vive en la zona Sajama de la ciudad de El Alto, en compañía de sus hijos y sus 9 nietos.

Socia de Pro Mujer hace 5 años, Teresa se dedica a la confección de chompas de lana, mismas que comercializa de forma ambulante en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz .

Con su primer desembolso, logra incrementar su mercadería, para posteriormente adquirir una máquina de costura, lo que le permite mejorar sus ingresos sustancialmente.

Actualmente Teresa paralelamente a la confección de chompas de lana se dedica a confeccionar ropa de bebe (chambritas), y necesita de más capital para poder comprar materia prima que le permita satisfacer la demanda existente y del mismo modo aumentar la variedad de sus productos.

loans.use: Buy raw materials with which to meet existing demand and offer a wider variety of products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E., is a 62 year old widow with 5 children. She lives in  Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has being with LAPO for 5 years and believes it has been a source of financial strength for her business. She sells food stuff and needs the money to buy more food for resale.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth Morón Salazar is married to a taxi driver and is the mother of 4 children. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for more than 2 years. She prepares and sells a type of fried empanadas known as empanadas tucumanas, by contract and to order. At the same time she also works selling various products, decorative items, small appliances, jewelry and other items that she brings from the city of Oruro.

At the present time Ruth is simply maintaining her commercial business while focusing principally on her fried empanada business. She acquired an industrial frier, which allows her to sign contracts for greater volume and in this way increase the income she provides to her family. Ruth needs capital to be able to build her inventory of merchandise now, in preparation for the holidays at the end of the year. As December nears, the prices she pays for the merchandise she sells will increase, reducing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth Morón Salazar, casada con un chofer de taxi, y madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Pro Mujer hace más de 2 años, se dedica a la preparación de empanadas fritas (tucumanas) según contrato y a pedido. Paralelamente a esta actividad, la señora Ruth se dedica a la comercialización de productos varios, como ser adornos, electrodomésticos, joyas, y otros que trae de la ciudad de Oruro.

En la actualidad la señora Ruth, mantiene su negocio de comercio de productos y principalmente la preparación de empanadas fritas a contrato. Para esto ella adquirió una freidora industrial, la que le permite firmar contratos por una mayor cantidad, de esta forma generar mayores ingresos para su familia.

Ruth necesita de capital para poder preparar toda su mercadería en vista de la cercanía de las fiestas de fin de año, puesto que a medida de que pasa el tiempo y se acerca el mes de diciembre, los precios de la mercadería que comercializa, se incrementa y por tanto reducen sus ganancias.

loans.use: Ruth  needs capital to be able to build an inventory of merchandise now in preparation for the holidays at the end of the year. As December nears, the prices she pays for the merchandise she sells will increase, reducing her earnings.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa works in a primary school in which she has been provided with an area where she can sell her typical local foods, including tacos, tortas, chalupas (stuffed tortillas) and empanadas, along with sweets, cookies and soft drinks. She is 48 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She belongs to the loan group Fanny 7, together with Mrs. Carmen García Sánchez, who sells sweets and cookies, and Mrs. Alicia Gómez Cruz, who owns a grocery store. With the loan they hope to make improvements to their work places and Alicia will buy merchandise with which to better stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nicolasa trabaja en una escuela primaria en donde le facilitan un lugar en donde pueda vender productos típicos de la zona (tacos, tortas, chalupas, empanadas) y además dulces, galletas y refrescos. Ella tiene 48 años, casada, cinco hijos y su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil. Ella pertenece al grupo Fanny 7, junto con: doña Carmen García Sánchez (venta de dulces y galletas), y doña Alicia Gómez Cruz (tienda de abarrotes). Con el préstamo esperan poder acondicionar los lugares de trabajo y Alicia comprar mercadería para abastecer mejor su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: sales of typical foods

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience E. is 58 years old and happily married with 5 children.  She hails from an urban sector of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She makes soap and sells oil wholesale. She needs the above loan to buy gallons and drums of oil for making soap.

loans.use: To buy oil for her soapmaking business

loans.name: Mkwamba

texts.en:
Mkwebmba is a 53-year-old resident of Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with four children and two other dependents. For the past three years, she has been running a charcoal business at her home. She has suppliers from up-country, mainly from the Morogoro and Pwani Regions of central Tanzania, and she sells at place as a retailer. Apart from charcoal, she also rents chairs for various functions like weddings and other public gatherings, and this business is still in its initial stages.

She is need of 450 US dollars to help her boost her charcoal business.

loans.use: Expand Stock

loans.name: Selma

texts.es:
A member of the communal association Stars of the Sea of the Villa Adela center, Selma is a stylist by profession and the mother of 2 school age children. She joined Pro Mujer approximately a year and a half ago.

She used to work as an assistant in various beauty salons on the Avenida 16 de Julio, dreaming of the day when she would be able to have her own business.

Two years ago, thanks to the help of a relative, Selma succeeded in opening her own beauty salon, very modest and with barely the space necessary. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to buy hair color, creams and other products she needs for her work.

At the moment Selma needs capital to be able to expand her business. Thanks to her good work, demand for her services is outpacing her capacity to provide them. For this reason, she would like to buy a stylist's table and more materials to be able to hire employees and establish herself in the industry, thereby improving her quality of her life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Pertenece a la Asociación Comunal Estrellas de Mar del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, de profesión estilista, Selma R. es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar. Ingresa a Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 1 año y medio.

Trabajó como ayudante en varios salones de belleza de la Av. 16 de Julio, soñando siempre en el día en que podría tener su propio negocio.

Hace 2 años y gracias a la ayuda de uno de sus familiares, Selma logra la apertura de su propio salón de belleza, muy modesto y con el mobiliario apenas necesario. Gracias al primer crédito desembolsado, logra comprar tintes, cremas y otros productos para poder realizar su trabajo.

Actualmente Selma necesita de capital para poder ampliar su negocio, puesto que gracias a su buen trabajo, la demanda de su clientela rebasa su capacidad, es por eso que quiere comprar un tocador y más material de trabajo para poder tener algunos dependientes y establecerse en el rubro, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Selma needs capital to be able to expand her business. Thanks to her good work, demand for her services is outpacing her capacity; she would like to buy a stylist's table and more materials which would allow her to hire employees and establish herself in the industry.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia sells clothes that she buys at the border with Guatemala, in a place called Mesilla, because they're less expensive there; she then sells them in a shop that she borrows or, sometimes, from her house. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She wants to use the loan to get her own shop so that she can display her products there. She belongs to the Francelia 3 group along with dona Martha Navarro Diaz (grocery store) and dona Guadalupe Navarro Diaz (grocery store). They'll combine the loan and buy merchandise at wholesale that they'll then divide up to stock their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ALICIA se dedica a la venta de ropa que compra en la frontera con Guatemala en un lugar llamado Mesilla ya que ahí es más económica, posteriormente lo vende en un local que le prestan y a veces en su casa. Ella tiene 40 años, casada, cuatro hijos. Con el préstamo quiere conseguir su propio local y exponer ahí sus productos. Pertenece al grupo Francelia 3 junto con doña Martha Navarro Díaz (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Guadalupe Navarrro Díaz (tienda de abarrotes). Ambas juntaran su préstamo y compraran mercadería al por mayor y luego se la repartirán para abastecer sus tiendas.

loans.use: Clothing sales.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy D., a member of the Villa Adela Association, is a mother of 3 school-age children. She joined Pro Mujer approximately 1 ½ years ago and worked, from 5 years ago, as a beautician at businesses dedicated to that field.

Three months ago, she changed her line of work and now sells electrical appliances that she brings from the city of Oruro, a business that seems to be more lucrative than what she was doing before.

Nancy now needs to pull together enough capital so that she can take an empty store in her house and convert it to a shop for the sale of electrical appliances, etc., but that will only be possible when she pulls together around $2,000. In the meantime, her goal is to travel to the Oruro to be able to take advantage of the prices before the holidays at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy D., pertenece a la Asociación Villa Adela, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar. Ingresa a Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 1 año y medio y trabaja hace 5 años como consultora de belleza en empresas dedicadas a este rubro.

Hace 3 meses cambia de rubro y se dedica a la comercialización de electrodomésticos que trae de la ciudad de Oruro, negocio que al parecer le trae más réditos que su anterior actividad.

Actualmente Nancy precisa reunir capital, puesto que ella tiene una tienda vacía en su domicilio, que quiere convertir en un centro de venta de electrodomésticos y varios, pero esto solo será posible cuando ella reúna aproximadamente 2 mil dólares. Mientras tanto su objetivo son los viajes a la ciudad de Oruro para poder aprovechar los precios antes de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Nancy needs to pull together enough capital so that she can take an empty store in her house and convert it to a shop for the sale of electrical appliances, etc.

loans.name: Mayda Araceli

texts.es:
Mayda sells perfumes and cosmetics to the people of her neighborhood. She also sells clothes from her house that she buys in San Cristobal de las Casas. She is 28 years old and married with two children. Her husband works in the fields planting maiz. She belongs to the Fracelia 3 group with dona Delsi P. P. (perfume and cosmetics sales) and dona Hilse Ovando Ramirez (footwear sales). They hope to use the loan to buy more merchandise so that they have better supplies to offer their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MAYDA, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos a pedido de la gente de su comunidad, además vende ropa en su casa la cual va a comprar a San Cristóbal de las Casas, ella esta casada, tiene 28 años, dos hijos y su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz. Ella pertenece al grupo Francelia 3 junto con doña Delsi Pérez Pérez (venta de perfumes y cosméticos) y doña Hilse Ovando Ramírez (venta de calzado). Con el préstamo esperan comprar más mercancía para tener mayor surtido para ofrecerle a sus clientas.

loans.use: Clothing sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 54 years old, happily married with 6 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells used bed spreads, wrappers, curtains and shoes. She is a union leader and has being with LAPO for 4 years. She needs this money to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina M., a divorced mother of two, is the treasurer of the Estrellas de Mar association, of Villa Adela and a street vendor who earns her living making pastries: pan dulces, masitas, cookies, cakes, etc. She makes the pastries herself and then sells them at sports centers, plazas and parks in the area so that she can try and help herself and her children get ahead.

Cristina used to work at a company that exported broad beans but after a gall bladder illness, she had to leave the job. She subsequently worked at making traditional vicuna blankets but because her health was fragile, she wasn’t able to continue. Back pains and some heart problems forced her to change her line of work so she taught herself the art of the pastry shop.

Cristina now needs capital so that she can buy an industrial oven that will allow her to increase her production, improve her earnings and get ahead with her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina M., divorciada y madre de 2 hijos, es tesorera de la asociación Estrellas de Mar, de Villa Adela, se dedica a la repostería, pan dulce, masitas, galletas, queques, productos que ella misma prepara y que luego deambula por los centros deportivos, plazas y parques de la zona, con lo cual trata de salir adelante en compañía de sus hijos.

Anteriormente, Cristina trabajaba en una empresa de exportación de habas, pero a consecuencia de una complicación vesicular, tuvo que dejar el trabajo. Posteriormente se dedico a la confección artesanal de mantas de vicuña, pero la fragilidad de su salud no le permitió seguir, ya que los dolores de espalda y algunas dolencias pulmonares, la obligaron a cambiar de rubro y aprender autodidácticamente el arte de la repostería.

Actualmente Cristina necesita de capital para poder comprar un horno industrial que le permita incrementar su producción, de esta manera intentar mejorar sus ingresos y salir adelante con sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Cristina needs capital so that she can buy an industrial oven that will allow her to increase her production, improve her earnings and get ahead with her two children.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz sells clothes which she buys in the city of Tuxtla Gutierrez (an hour from her town) and then sells on the streets of the neighborhoods near her town. She is a 52-year old widow with 9 children. She belongs to the Jastic 1 group along with dona Lorena Jimenez P. (clothes sales) and Carmen H. Morales (food and sweets sales). With the loan, they will buy more clothes to supply their businesses and Carmen wants to fix up a place at the school where she sells her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LUZ se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual va a comprar a la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez (a una hora de su localidad) y posteriormente la vende de manera ambulante en las colonias cercanas a su localidad. Ella tiene 52 años, tuvo 9 hijos y esta viuda. Pertenece la grupo Jastic 1 junto con doña Lorena Jiménez Pérez (venta de ropa) y Carmen Hernández Morales (venta de comida y dulces). Ellas con el préstamo compraran mas ropa para abastecer sus negocios y Carmen quiere acondicionar un lugar en la escuela donde vende sus productos.

loans.use: Clothes sales.

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa Igbeinovia is 40 yearls old and married with 5 children; she is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells clothes, shoes & bags. She needs the above loan for expansion.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes & bags for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia R., the head of the Flor de la Canela association, has been a member of Pro Mujer for approximately 10 years; she’s married, with 5 grown children, and works at making all kinds of clothing.

Julia has worked at clothes-making since 1977; along with her husband, she was able to establish this business by introducing her products at the main street markets in the city.

Julia now needs capital to be able to buy a fusionadora (a machine for clothes-making) that will allow her to increase the variety of clothes that she makes. She has also started the process of legalizing her small business and completing the necessary requirements for registering it, with all the social obligations and taxes that entails, but all the benefits, too.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia Rodríguez, es jefa de grupo de la asociación Flor de la Canela, aproximadamente 10 años que permanece en Pro Mujer, es casada, con 5 hijos mayores, se dedica a la confección de de todo tipo de prendas de vestir.

Desde el año 1977, Julia se dedica a la confección, al lado de su marido pudo establecer este negocio, introduciendo sus productos en las principales ferias de esta ciudad.

Actualmente Julia precisa de capital para poder comprar una máquina fusionadora que le permita incrementar la variedad de piezas y confecciones. Del mismo modo ha iniciado el proceso de legalización de su pequeña empresa y cumpliendo los requisitos necesarios para poder registrarse con todas las obligaciones sociales e impositivas y del mismo modo recibir los beneficios que esto conlleva.

loans.use: Julia needs capital to be able to buy a fusionadora (a machine for clothes-making) that will allow her to increase the variety of clothes that she makes.

loans.name: Lucinda Esperanza

texts.es:
Lucinda is 58-years old and married, with six children; her husband is a farmer. She sells fruits, vegetables, clay pots and other products that aren't readily available in the neighborhoods where she goes, from a pushcart. She belongs to the Jastic 1 group, along with dona Irene Jimenez Perez (clothes sales), Areli Hernandez Perez (baked chicken sales) and Floridalma Perez Lopez (shoe sales). With the loan, they will increase their supplies of goods for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCINDA tiene 58 años, casada, seis hijos, y su esposo trabaja en el campo como agricultor. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras, ollas de barro y en general productos que no se encuentran en las colonias a las cuales va a vender en un carro ambulante. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 1, junto con doña Irene Jiménez Pérez (venta de ropa), Areli Hernández Pérez (venta de pollo horneado) y Floridalma Pérez López (venta de zapatos). Con el préstamo aumentaran el abastecimiento de mercancía.

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia Tinini, the mother of a 4-year old child, is single and a member of the Flor de la Canela community association; she operates a small grocery store that she managed to open with the help of Pro Mujer.

Previously, Teodocia worked at making and selling vicuna blankets, a business that supported her for almost 10 years and that was passed down to her by her family, her mother, mainly.

Currently, Teodocia manages her own small store and needs capital to set up a telephone call station, something that will eventually lead to her getting a house for herself and her son; the house that she rents now takes so much of her earnings that she can’t provide the things her little one needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodocia T., es madre de 1 niño de 4 años, soltera, y miembro de la asociación comunal Flor de la canela, se dedica a la atención de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, que logro abrir con la ayuda de Pro Mujer.

Anteriormente, Teodocia se dedicaba a la confección y venta de mantas de vicuña, negocio en el que se mantuvo casi por 10 años, y que era una herencia familiar, principalmente de su madre.

Actualmente Teodocia administra su pequeño almacén, pero necesita de capital para poder instalar una central de llamadas telefónicas, de esta manera ver la manera de conseguir una vivienda para ella y su hijo, ya que el alquiler de la casa donde vive, resta mucho sus ingresos y no permite brindar las comodidades necesarias a su pequeño.

loans.use: Teodocia manages her own small store and needs capital to set up a telephone call station, something that will eventually lead to her getting a house for herself and her son; the house that she rents now takes so much of her earnings that she can’t provide the things her little one needs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 39 years old and has 6 children.  She lives in an urban area of Benin City, Edo State Nigeria.  She sells food & provisions and needs the above loan to expand her business.  She believes that LAPO has helped her business expand to a greater height.

loans.use: To buy more provision & food stuff

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa is a 30-year old single woman. To help her family, she has a cafe with a partner, Margarita M. J., who is another member of the Jastic 2 group. The other members of the group are Dona Ernestina Bautista (clothes sales) and Antonia M. J. (sales of plastic containers for storing food). With the loan, Rosa and Margarita will improve the look of the cafe to draw more customers; Ernestina will buy more clothes in different sizes to increase her customer base; and Antonia will buy more supplies of containers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA tiene 30 años, soltera. Para ayudar a su familia tiene una cafetería en sociedad con Margarita Méndez Juárez quien es otra integrante del grupo Jastic 2. Las otras integrantes del grupo son doña Ernestina Bautista (venta de ropa) y Antonia Méndez Juárez (venta de posillos de plástico para mantener alimento). Con el préstamo Rosa y Margarita hermosearan el local para una mejor atención a sus clientes, Ernestina comprara mas ropa en diferentes tallas para aumentar su clientela, y Antonia comprara mas surtido de trastes.

loans.use: Cafe

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Manai de Chura has 7 children. She runs a small grocery store, and in additions she sells food. She distributes her efforts over the days of the week.

On Wednesdays and Saturdays, she sells vegetables in the market place of the Luis Espinal neighborhood of El Alto. On Thursdays and Sundays, she sells food in the marketplace "16 de Julio", also in the city of El Alto. The rest of the days she works in her grocery store.

She needs money to increase her merchandise, and to buy foodstuffs in order to be able to open a lunch restaurant as there is a great need for this in her neighborhood. This is the only way Isabel can maintain the large number of children she has.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Isabel M. de Chura, es madre de 7 hijos, se dedica a la atención de un pequeño almacén de abarrotes, pero paralelamente vende comida, actividades que distribuye muy bien durante la semana.

Los días miércoles y sábado se dedica a la venta de verduras en la feria de la zona Luis Espinal, y los días jueves y domingo se dedica a la venta de comida en la feria 16 de Julio, también de la ciudad de El Alto, el resto de los días de la semana se dedica a la atención de su almacén.

Ella precisa de dinero para poder incrementar su mercadería, y del mismo modo aprovisionarse de insumos para la atención de sus comensales, ya que su principal objetivo es la apertura de un restaurante para la atención de almuerzos, para satisfacer la gran demanda de su zona. Solo de esta forma podrá dar sustento al gran número de hijos que Isabel tiene.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to buy foodstuffs in order to be able to open a lunch restaurant

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Mrs. Priscilla O. is 35 years old, married with 3 children and hails from an urban sector in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years. She sells drugs and need the above loan to improve her business. She has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy drugs for sale

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
Maria Graciela sells refreshments from a small store she runs from her home in order to contribute to the family income. She is 21 years old and single. She belongs to the group "Jastic 2", together with Mrs. Mariana Hernández Pérez (sale of fruits and vegetables), and Mrs. Lili Cruz Narváez (sale of clothing). With the loan, Maria Graciela plans to expand her store, Mariana will buy a cart to go out and sell her products to nearby neighborhoods, and Lili will buy a large assortment of clothing.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

MARIA GRACIELA se dedica a la venta de refrescos en un pequeño depósito que tiene en su casa y de esta forma contribuye al gasto familiar, es soltera y tiene 21 años. Pertenece la grupo Jastic 2 junto con doña Mariana Hernández Pérez (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Lili Cruz Narváez (venta de ropa). Con el préstamo Maria Graciela agrandara su local, Mariana comprara un carrito para salir a vender sus productos a las colonias cercanas, y Lili comprara un gran surtido de ropa.

loans.use: Sale of refreshments

loans.name: Lucefina

texts.es:
Lucefina is a widow of 63 years old, with 5 children. She has a small restaurant in her home. With the loan, she wants to do maintenance to her restaurant and improve it to provide a better ambient to her customers. She belongs to the group "Jastic 3" together with Mrs. Aurora Pérez Mora (artist), Maria Victoria Pérez Cruz (bakery), and María Molina Urbina (sale of bracelets, rings, and necklaces). With the loan, Aurora will buy thread and lace to make traditional clothes from Chiapas; Maria Victoria will buy a quintal (~100 lbs) of flour to increase her bread production, and María will buy a showcase to exhibit her products.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

LUCEFINA es viuda, tiene 63 años, cinco hijos. Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante instalado en su casa, con el préstamo espera darle mantenimiento a su local y adecuarlo de una mejor manera para la atención de sus clientes. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 3 junto con doña Aurora Pérez Mora (artesana), Maria Victoria Pérez Cruz (panadera) y Maria Molina Urbina (venta de pulseras, añillos y collares). Con el préstamo Aurora comprara hilos, encajes para hacer trajes típicos del estado chiapaneco, Maria Victoria comprara un quintal de harina para aumentar la producción de su pan y María comprara una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Mrs. Bola I. is 52 years old and married with 5 children.  She lives in an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells clothing and needs money to buy more clothes. She has been in this business since 2002

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale

loans.name: Nidia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nidia is 26 years old, married, with 1 child. Her husband is an electrician. She owns a beauty salon where she treats women of her community: hair cuts, manicures, and make-up for social events. She will invest the loan in the purchase of beauty products. She belongs to the group "Jastic 4" together with Mrs. Maria Candelaria Hernández López (door-to-door sales of tamales) and Mrs. Ana Isabel Valencia Díaz (food sales). They will invest their loans in kitchen utensils and raw products to make their products.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

NIDIA tiene 26 años, casada, un hijo, su esposo es electricista. Ella una estética en donde atiende a las mujeres de su localidad cortándoles el cabello, arreglo de uñas, y maquillándolas para los eventos sociales, con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 4 junto con doña Maria Candelaria Hernández López (venta de tamales casa por casa) y doña Ana Isabel Valencia Díaz (venta de comida). Ellas dos invertirán su préstamo en utensilios de cocina y materia prima para elaborar sus productos.

loans.use: Beauty salon

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah O. is 44 years old and married with 4 children, she hails from an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been member of LAPO for four years. She sells smoked fish and needs the above loan to expand her business. She has been in this business since 1971.

loans.use: To invest in her fishing business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita sells dairy products from her home (cheese, cream, yogurt, and milk). She is married, 64 years old, and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. With her share of the loan, she wants to buy a refrigerator to preserve her products for a longer time. She belongs to the group "Jastic 5", together with Mrs. Lucinda Hernández López (sales of tacos from her home), who, with her part of the loan, wants to set up a space and buy kitchen utensils for improved production of her food products.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

BENITA se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en su domicilio (queso, crema, yogurt, leche), ella es casada, tiene 64 años, tuvo cinco hijos, su esposo es agricultor, con la parte de su préstamo quiere comprar un refrigerador para conservar sus productos por mas tiempo. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 5 junto con doña Lucinda Hernández López (venta de tacos en su casa) con la parte de su préstamo acondicionara el lugar y comprara utensilios de cocina para la mejor elaboración de sus alimentos.

loans.use: Dairy sales

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina Z. is a 35 year old single woman; she lives in an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since 1999.  LAPO has improved my financial life style she said, I have being in LAPO for the past 5 years as a leader of the union.  I am 35 years old. She sells fabrics, shoes, bags and jewelery. She needs a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, jewelery & bags for sale

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works in construction. She prepares food by order for social events in her community. She belongs to the group "Jastic 5", together with Eunice Sánchez Beltrán (food sales to community- together with Araceli). With the loan, they want to buy kitchen utensils and to set up a kitchen where they can prepare food in large quantities.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

ARACELI tiene 34 años, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en la construcción. Ella se dedica a preparar comida a pedido para eventos sociales dentro de su localidad. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 5 junto con Eunice Sánchez Beltrán (venta de comida en sociedad con Araceli) por lo tanto con el préstamo esperan comprar utensilios de cocina y acondicionar un lugar especial para preparar alimentos en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Food Sales

loans.name: Iyobosa Isere

texts.en: "My LAPO loan has lifted my business," says Mr. Iyobosa Isere E., who lives in the urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 37 years old and has 2 children. He sells fairly used clothes and needs the above amount for the expansion of his business. He has been in business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy bales of fairly-used clothes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy O. is married with 4 children; she is 50 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mercy has been with LAPO for 4 years. She has a little restaurant and needs this loan to improve her micro-business. She hopes that with the loan of $275 she will be able to improve the quality and quantity of her food and provide services to more customers.

loans.use: To buy cartons of drinks & foodstuffs for her little restaurant

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a widow who is raising her thirteen year old daughter on her own. She supports herself and her daughter with an exciting cosmetics sales business in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine.

Vera has a network of five sales kiosks and has hired sixteen employees to work for her. She took over running the business after her husband passed away. He originally started selling fifteen years ago. Lower prices than her competitors and good locations for her sales kiosks have been two factors contributing to the success of Vera’s enterprise. Loans received through Nadiya Ukraine have also helped her expand her business.

One of Vera’s present goals is to focus on developing her current sales locations. She has requested a loan to help purchase a bulk supply of perfume to sell in her kiosks.

loans.use: Purchase perfume in bulk for cosmetics business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei owns a men’s clothing business at the Sigma Sport market in Nikolaev, Ukraine. He started his business three years ago because he saw a potential for growth. Sergei has requested a loan to help accomplish some of that growth by opening a second sales location. He has developed a solid business and is looking forward to expanding.

Sergei is a hard worker and is very dedicated to what he does which shows in how he conducts his business. His large product selection and quality items are popular with his customers. Sergei is married and he has one daughter who is a college student.

Sergei is grateful for the financial assistance he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Using capital from a previous loan, he was able to increase his sales and his profits went up. As a result of Sergei’s experience using micro-lending, one of his neighbors in the market heard about the financial resources that are available from Nadiya Ukraine and was also able to obtain a business loan. We a happy for this and many other opportunities to make a difference in the lives of entrepreneurs like Sergei.

loans.use: Open second sales location

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy O. is married with 5 children and is 50 years old. She comes from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Joy has been with LAPO for 10 years. She sells foodstuffs and meats. She needs a loan of $325 to buy bags of rice, beans, and other foodstuffs to expand the inventory of her little shop.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, beans, etc. to expand her inventory

loans.name: Alis

texts.en: Alis A. is 64, a widow with 6 children, from a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 7 years as a leader of a union. Alis sells drinks and operates a guest house. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and to maintain her guest house.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Obosa

texts.en:
"I sell soft drinks wholesale to people in my community. Serving my customers gives me great satisfaction." says Mrs. Obosa U., a member of one of the LAPO branches in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Obosa is 36 years old, married with two children. She hopes to expand her business with this loan of $800. Obosa has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for her wholesale business

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba is 39 years old and works for the state. By her sister's advice she decided to start her own business in addition to her job. She travels to pick up the goods that her sister sells for her. The assortment of goods includes women's clothing and foot wear. Habiba has been an active Mikroinvest client since 2005. Her business has grown to twice it's original size. She purchases the goods not only from the local wholesale stores, but directly from the city of Alma Ata's wholesale dealers. Because of this she makes more profits. Currently Habiba has no permanent trading place, that is why she is applying for a loan to expand her business and use the profits towards rent. The picture shows Habiba's sister.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva volunteer.

Хабиба работает на государственной службе. Дополнительно к этому она, посоветовавшись с сестрой, решила начать заниматься бизнесом. Хабиба ездит за товаром, а сестра торгует. Хабибе 39 лет. Ассортимент товаров составляет женская одежда и обувь. В Микроинвест Хабиба кредитуется с 2005 года. За это время обороты ее бизнеса возросли вдвое. Кроме местных оптовых рынков она стала приобретать товар для реализации у оптовиков привозящих товар из Алма-Аты. Это приносит дополнительную прибыль. В данный момент у нее нет постоянного места для торговли, и поэтому Хабиба хочет получить займ для расширения бизнеса, чтобы прибыль, полученная от бизнеса, позволила в будущем арендовать торговое место. На фото Вы видите сестру Хабибы.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 32 years old. She has 2 children whom she is responsible to support, since her husband was killed in a terrorist attack. She has a sewing business in her home. She has applied to get $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth. She want s to develop her business and increase her sales to enhance her living standard .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Luís Carlos

texts.en:
Luis is a hard working man, born in the town of Linares in Nuevo Leon. He's married and has four children. His wife runs a small grocery store. After being laid off from his last job three years ago, Luis started a business renting video game machines. He started out with only two machines, but through hard work and good service his business has grown rapidly and he now owns fifteen video game machines.

Luis is requesting a loan of US $250 to buy new games with which to program his video game machines, allowing him to provide better service. He will repay this loan over a period of 3 months. Your support can help Luis expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

En estos momentos Luís está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de discos de videojuegos recientes para actualizar la programación de sus máquinas y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, él se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Luís.

loans.use: Maintenance and Updating of Equipment

loans.name: Martina Isabel

texts.en:
Martina is 35 years old and lives with her common-law partner and their children, 11 and 15 years old. Her partner works in construction. Two years ago, Martina started her own business preparing and selling foods to help improve her family's quality of life. She had gained experience in this industry while working with her sister, who ran a similar business. Little by little she has gained many customers and her business has grown significantly.

Martina also does catering for special events and she has been asked to cater a wedding. She is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy the ingredients and supplies she will need to meet this order. She agrees to repay the loan over a period of 4 months and thanks you for providing her with the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, de 11 y 15 años de edad. Su pareja se dedica a la construcción y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Martina decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace dos años con la elaboración y venta de comidas, anteriormente le ayudaba a su hermana que tenía un negocio similar, en donde adquirió experiencia y después decidió independizarse, poco a poco fue dándose a conocer y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener muchos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.,

Martina también elabora banquetes para eventos especiales y en estos momentos tiene un pedido para boda, pero no cuenta con los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos, por este motivo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de los insumos que necesita, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Martina y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de poder mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is 30 years old, lives with her domestic partner and has three children (3, 7 and 11 years old). Her partner Oscar is a construction worker, but his salary is insufficient to cover the basic needs of the family. For this reason, Maria started her grocery store business four years ago. Previously, she used to sell clothes, but the profit was not good. Now with her store she is doing much better and, little by little, has managed to increase the variety of the products she offers, as well as the number of her clients. The love for her family and her wish that their children have access to a good education motivate her to try harder every day.

In order to continue growing and to improve the quality of the service she offers, she is requesting a $250 loan, that she’ll repay in four months, and which she plans to use for the purchase of merchandise to cover the needs of her clients. Maria trusts people that help the most needful and is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given to improve and to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 7 y 11 años de edad. Óscar, su pareja, trabaja en la construcción, pero su salario es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Por este motivo, Maria comenzó su negocio de abarrotes hace cuatro años. Anteriormente vendía ropa pero no recibía buenas ganancias. Ahora con su tienda le ha ido mucho mejor y poco a poco ha logrado incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su negocio, así como sus clientes. El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de que sus hijos puedan tener acceso a una buena educación la motivan a esforzase más cada día.

Para continuar creciendo y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $250 dólares, que regresará en 4 meses, y que planea utilizar en la compra de mercancía para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Maria confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesitan, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que se le brinda de poder mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.en:
Jose Hector is a 64 year old widower who has eight children. Finding it very difficult to find a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business six years ago selling groceries. He started out selling a small selection of basic products and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. His business has expanded greatly thanks to his efforts and he was recently able to purchase a larger refrigerator.

Jose is requesting a loan of US $650 to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

José Héctor es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, tiene 64 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 8 hijos. Ante la dificultad de encontrar un empleo y para obtener los recursos que necesita, José inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace seis años, comenzó con muy pocos productos, los de mayor demanda, y poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor e incorporando la venta de más productos, recientemente ha adquirido un enfriador más grande y su negocio ha crecido mucho gracias al buen trabajo que realiza día con día.

En estos momentos, José necesita un crédito de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de José y ayudarlo a continuar creciendo con su negocio, no lo dudes más, tu ayuda será de mucha utilidad para José, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban is married and has four sons and two daughters; he's originally from Veracruz, where he started his business selling elotes - corn on the cob -fifteen years ago. Seeking better opportunities, he moved his family to Linares, Nuevo Leon, where he continued his business assisted by his wife and children. Through hard work he has been able to buy two food carts that he uses to sell his products. He's also been able to finance his home and buy a pick up truck. When the opportunity arises, he also works as a mover and making deliveries.

Esteban is a very responsible and entrepreneurial man who wants the best for his family. He's requesting a loan in the amount of US $325 to buy supplies and to expand his elote business. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. You can become an important part of his family's life by supporting his business. He is grateful for the opportunity and considers any assistance a blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Esteban es casado y tiene 4 hijos y 2 hijas, es originario de Veracruz, donde inició su negocio de venta de elotes hace quince años, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia decidieron mudarse a la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León, donde continuó con su trabajo recibiendo la ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Gracias al esfuerzo y buen trabajo que realiza día con día, con el ingreso que obtiene ha logrado adquirir dos triciclos en donde vende sus productos, una camioneta y ha logrado financiar su casa. Cuando tiene oportunidad trabaja también realizando fletes, principalmente a personas que se cambian de casa.

Esteban es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable que sólo busca lo mejor para su familia, en estos momentos necesita de un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los elotes y poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia, Esteban agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas, tu ayuda será de gran bendición.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.en:
Bertha is married and has six children - five are already married and another one is in school. Her husband is a merchant who doesn't have a steady income, so for the past fifteen years Bertha has been selling tacos and other foods to help with her family's expenses. She started out selling tacos to workers in the local market, and eventually obtained a license to set up a stall and sell her foods there. The high quality of her products gained her many clients and helped her business grow.

Bertha is asking for a loan of US $475 to buy supplies to help her meet the increased demand for her products. She will repay the loan over a period of six months. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Lidia es casada y tiene seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya están casados y uno es estudiante. Su esposo es comerciante y no cuenta con un ingreso seguro y para ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus hijos, desde hace quince años Bertha se dedica a la venta de comidas y tacos, inicialmente les vendía tacos a las personas que trabajaban en el mercado y después gracias a ellos logró conseguir un permiso para poder instalarse y vender ahí mismo. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Berta necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos que necesita para incrementar su producción y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia y contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, Bertha agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.en:
Jose Raul is married and has three children; his family is the motivation behind the start up of his own business selling food eleven years ago. Noticing the great opportunity and lack of competition, he decided to start selling tacos and added other products, such as roast meats, as demand increased. His business grew and he now sells his products in several markets.

Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of US $1200 to be used for supplies to expand his product line and improve his service. This will ensure that he meets his customers' demand, allowing his business to grow. Jose considers your assistance a blessing and he and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

José Raúl es un hombre emprendedor, está casado y tiene tres hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas desde hace 11 años. Al observar la oportunidad y poca competencia de este giro en los mercados decidió comenzar a vender tacos, obtuvo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y gracias a la creciente demanda que tenía fue incorporando la venta de otros alimentos como cabrito y carnes asadas, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora se instala en diferentes mercados.

Para poder mejorar la calidad de su servicio e incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, en estos momentos José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Forma parte de los logros de José, él y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar, tu ayuda es de gran bendición.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Doralina

texts.en:
Doralina is 50 years old and has been a widow for more than 15 years. Since her husband died in a traffic accident, she has lived alone with two sons and a daugher, all of whom work and are financially independent.

She had the difficult mission of raising three children alone, as her oldest son was only 10 years old when her husband died. Today, her youngest daughter is 19 and works and attends school. Her middle son works and attends law school and her oldest son works as a teller at a bank. They all help her out in her business with a voluntary monthly contribution.

Doralina runs a small grocery store where she sells staples such as sugar, flour, milk, pasta and rice. Despite stiff competition, her business thrives and is the most successful in the neighborhood thanks to her good service and her extensive inventory.

Doralina is requesting a loan in the amount of US $200 to purchase additional inventory of soft drinks, dairy products, flour, sugar and canned goods at wholesale prices to take advantage of the growing population in her area and the increased demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Doralina tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda ya hace mas de 15 años, su esposo falleció en un accidente de tránsito. Desde entonces vive sola con sus dos hijos varones y una mujer, quienes ya poseen independencia económica pues todos trabajan.

Ella tuvo la difícil misión de criar 3 niños, sola, ya que su marido falleció cuando su hijo mayor contaba con apenas 10 años. Hoy día, su hija menor tiene 19 años estudia y trabaja, el segundo de sus hijos trabaja en un negocio y estudia leyes en la facultad; el mayor trabaja en un Banco de la zona como cajero, todos le ayudan a su madre en el negocio con un aporte mensual que cada hijo le entrega de forma voluntaria.

Doralina tiene una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como leche, azúcar, harina, fideos, arroz, etc. Actualmente ya con mucha experiencia y clientela formada, y a pesar de que en la zona en donde se encuentra hay varias despensas, su negocio es el que más éxito tiene gracias a su buena atención y variedad.

Doralina solicita un crédito de $ 200, pues desea adquirir en mayor cantidad bebidas como gaseosas y lácteos, además de azúcar, harina, productos enlatados y fideos de esta forma puede aprovechar mejor el crecimiento de la población en la zona y poder satisfacer la necesidad de toda su clientela.

loans.use: To purchase inventory at wholesale - soft drinks, dairy products, flour, sugar, canned goods and pasta

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. María Z. is 35 years old and married to Mr. Ramón, 40 years old ; they have two children: a 13 years old girl and a 5 years old boy; they both attend school; they all live in their own house, located in the San Pedro neighborhood, with all the basic amenities, a few minutes from the center of the city of Encarnación.

Ms. María finished her university studies 10 years ago, as a pharmacist. Her husband is an ex soccer player, who played in several professional teams in Paraguay, but who had to abandon his passion early, as consequence of a serious injury in one of his knees he suffered then.

María is the owner of two pharmacies, one of which is run by herself and the other by her husband, both located in a strategical point going out of the city. She relates that, with great sacrifice, she saw her business grow and, thanks to that, they are able to provide a dignified life and education to their children.

Thanks to the good profits generated by both pharmacies, they are presently opening another one and, in order to stock it, María is asking for a $400 loan, with which to buy more supplies for the new location.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Z. tiene 35 años y está casada con el señor Ramón de 40 años; tienen dos hijos: una nena de 13 años y un varón de 5 años; ambos van a al colegio; viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el barrio San Pedro, con todas las comodidades básicas y a pocos minutos del centro de la ciudad de Encarnación.

La señora María culminó sus estudios universitarios hace 10 años, como licenciada en Farmacéutica. Su marido es un ex jugador de fútbol profesional, quién jugó en varios clubes importantes del Paraguay, pero tuvo que abandonar su pasión tempranamente, a consecuencia de una grave lesión que tuvo en aquel entonces en una de sus rodillas.

María es propietaria de dos farmacias, una de las cuales es atendida por ella y la otra por su esposo, ambas ubicadas en lugares estratégicos saliendo de la ciudad. Ella cuenta que, con mucho sacrificio pudo ver crecer su negocio, y gracias a ello pueden dar una vida y educación digna a sus hijos.

Gracias a las buenas ganancias que le generan ambas farmacias, hoy día están abriendo un local más y para poder abastecer de mercaderías, María, solicita un crédito de $400, con los que podrá comprar más medicamentos para surtir su nuevo local.

loans.use: purchase of pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ramona C. D. Z. is fifty-nine. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are married, have steady jobs, and are well paid, thanks to the fact that they finished their university studies. The youngest daughter is currently studying economics at the university. Ramona is very proud of her children; she always gave the highest priority to their education, and today they are in professional careers.

The couple owns their own home. She lives with her husband, who runs a carpentry business from home, and her youngest daughter. Ramona runs a business selling women's, children's, and men's clothing, such as T-shirts, trousers, shirts, skirts, and so on. Thanks to their good location (in her neighborhood there are not many shops that sell this kind of merchadise), she has many customers.

It is now winter [in Paraguay], and it is bitter cold. For this reason, she wants to buy winter clothes, such overcoats, jackets, scarves, and so on. To finance these purchases, she is seeking a loan of $300.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

La Señora Ramona D. 59 años está casada, y tiene 3 hijos, dos D. sus hijos ya están casados y cuentan con un trabajo estable, bien remunerado gracias a que culminaron sus estudios universitarios y la hija menor está cursando actualmente el último año D. la carrera D. Economía en la Universidad. Ramona está muy orgullosa D. sus hijos, ya que ella siempre priorizó el estudio D. estos y hoy día son excelentes profesionales. Ella vive en una casa propia con su esposo que es carpintero (posee su propia carpintería en su casa) y su hija menor. En su casa, Ramona, cuenta con un negocio donD. venD. ropas para damas, niños y caballeros tales como remeras, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc. Gracias a la buena ubicación, ella posee buena clientela, ya que en la zona no existen muchos negocios que se dediquen a la venta D. este tipo D. mercaderías. Ya que en esta época del año el invierno es bastante crudo, ella desea adquirir ropas D. abrigo en grandes cantidades, tales como buzos, camperas, bufandas, pulóver, etc.; para poder financiar esta compra, ella solicita un crédito D. $ 300.-

loans.use: To buy winter clothing, such as overcoats, jackets, scarves, pullovers, and so on

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is married and has two children ages 18 and 1. Her husband, Abelino Janeiro, is 41 years old and works as a construction worker.

Graciela sells spices such as pepper, oregano, cumin, anise, etc. She started out as an assistant in a business that processed, packaged and sold spices. After several years, she was able to pool together some savings and start her own business. She bought a packaging machine and with her eldest son's help she started processing and selling her own spices.

While her son tends to the business, she sells the spices door to door. Today, demand for her products has increased and she is requesting a loan in the amount of US $200 to invest in packaging materials, such as plastic bags, and an additional packaging machine.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Graciela es casada y es madre de 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 18 años y el menor 1 año. Su marido se llama Abelino Janeiro y tiene 41 años, y es constructor de obras.

Graciela se dedica a la venta de especias tales como pimienta, orégano, comino, anís y muchos otros más. Ella empezó como ayudante en un negocio que se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de los mismos, tras varios años ella pudo juntar unos ahorros y monto su propio negocio. Compró una máquina empaquetadora y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor elaborar y empaquetan las especias.

Su hijo atiene el negocio, y Graciela sale a vender de forma ambulante sus productos. Hoy día la demanda de sus productos va en aumento, por lo que desea un crédito de $ 200, que los invertirá en la compra de bolsitas y una máquina más, para empaquetar mayor cantidad de condimentos.

loans.use: To purchase a packaging machine and bags

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Estela is married and has three children. Her husband, Fredy A., is 38 years old. He is a factory employee and they live in a house in the center of the city. Since her husband’s income was not enough to support the family, she decided to make handiwork objects to sell. Thanks to previous loans, she was able to make progress and increase her production. Nowadays, she makes pillows, as this generates a higher profit. Since demand for her pillows is increasing, Estela is asking for a $200 loan, in order to buy fabrics in bulk, obtaining important discounts which will help increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Estela es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su marido, Fredy A. de 38 años, es empleado en una fábrica. Viven todos juntos en una casa en el centro de la ciudad. Como el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente para abastecer a la familia, ella decidió hacer manualidades para vender; gracias a préstamos anteriores pudo ir progresando y ampliando su producción. Hoy día, ella confecciona almohadas, ya que esto le genera mayores ingresos. En vista de que la demanda de sus almohadas va en aumento, Estela desea un crédito de $200, con los que podrá comprar telas al por mayor, obteniendo así importantes descuentos que ayudarán a aumentar significativamente su margen de ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Cándido

texts.es:
Mr. Cándido is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. He comes from a very poor family and, since he was a kid, he worked to contribute to the family income. He worked several years as an assistant in an auto repair shop and, after several years of learning and saving, he was able to set up his own shop, presently located at his home.

Because of the high quality of his work, he has a good number of clients. His work allows him to feed and provide education to his kids. Since he wasn’t able to receive a school education due to his parents' bad financial situation, his biggest dream is that his children finish their studies.

He wishes to continue making progress and wants to buy replacement parts to sell at his repair shop; in this way, he will be able to make profit with both the sale of these and his labor. He is asking for a $300 loan towards this end.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Cándido tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y es padre de 2 hijos. Cándido proviene de una familia muy humilde y desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar para poder aportar con los ingresos de la casa. Trabajó varios años como ayudante en un taller mecánico para autos, y tras varios años de aprendizaje y ahorro, pudo montar su propio taller, que hoy día se encuentra en su casa.

Posee una buena cantidad de clientes, ya que su trabajo es muy bueno; con su trabajo puede alimentar y dar educación a sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios, ya que él no tuvo la suerte de acceder a una educación escolar por la mala situación económica que atravesaban sus padres.

El desea seguir progresando y desea comprar repuestos para la venta en su taller; de esta forma podrá ganar con la venta de los mismos y la mano de obra de su trabajo. Para ello solicita un crédito de $300.

loans.use: Purchase of car replacement parts

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Carmen is 51 years old, married and has 6 children; her husband has run a butcher shop in the center of the city for more than 15 years, and all of her children go to school in the city. They all live in a house a couple of minutes from the center of the city.

Carmen runs a grocery store at home, where she sells all kinds of basic needs products, such as oil, sugar, noodles, rice, dairy products and bread. With time, her business has grown and she now has a good sized clientele, due to location, as there are not many similar businesses in the area.

Thanks to her profits, she has been able to provide a dignified life to her children and have them study. Since she only finished elementary school, it is her dream that, one day, her children will obtain a college degree.

Carmen is asking for $200, that she’ll invest in the purchase of more merchandise, such as oil, sugar, noodles, rice and soda, the products that are in greater demand among her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos; su marido tiene una carnicería en el centro de la ciudad hace ya más de 15 años y todos sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Viven todos juntos en una casa ubicada a minutos del centro de la ciudad.

Carmen tiene una despensa en su casa, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, como aceite, azúcar, fideos, arroz, productos lácteos y panificados entre otros. Con los años, su negocio fue ampliándose; ella cuenta con muy buen número de clientes gracias a la buena ubicación, pues la zona no cuenta con muchos negocios del mismo tipo.

Gracias a las buenas ganancias, ella puede dar una vida digna a sus hijos y hacerlos estudiar. Ya que ella solo concluyó sus estudios primarios, ella sueña que sus hijos puedan recibirse en la universidad algún día.

Carmen solicita $200, que invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías para la venta, tales como aceite, azúcar, fideos, arroz, y gaseosas, pues son estos los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise such as oil, sugar, noodles, rice and sodas.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial is a 45 years old widower, in charge of two daughters who attend a public school; they all live at his mother’s house.

Some years ago, Marcial moved to Argentina, looking for better work opportunities; he was a construction worker and, after saving enough money, he returned to Paraguay to start his own business.

He owns a grocery store at home, that he used to run with his late wife. After her passing, Marcial was left in charge of their daughters and the business. With great sacrifice, he saw his business grow and, today, it is one of the most popular grocery stores in the area.

Marcial wants to obtain a $600 loan, which he’ll invest in the purchase of more groceries to stock his store, such as canned and dairy products, candies and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcial tiene 45 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 2 hijas que estudian en una escuela pública; ellos viven todos juntos en la casa de la madre de Marcial.

Años atrás, Marcial viajó a Argentina en miras de mayores oportunidades laborales, trabajó como ayudante de construcción y luego de ahorrar dinero suficiente, volvió a Paraguay para montar su propio negocio.

El posee una despensa en su casa, que atendía en principio con su esposa. Tras el fallecimiento de ella, Marcial quedó a cargo de sus hijas y del negocio. Con mucho sacrificio pudo ver crecer el negocio y hoy día, es una de las despensas más populares de la zona.

Marcial desea solicitar un crédito de $600, que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para vender, tal como productos enlatados, lácteos, golosinas y gaseosas.

loans.use: Purchase of canned and dairy products, candies and sodas.

loans.name: Elsida

texts.en:
Elsida L. has lived in this house for the past eight years. She has had three children and is presently pregnant. Her business consists of cooking the traditional Dominican plates, such as rice and beans, chicken and goat meat. She sells these plates to laborers who have no other immediate source of food while working around the community. She tells us that business is good. Now she's looking to make her business larger.

Elsida buys the food ingredients in the local market. She wishes to be able to buy more in order to have a lower overall cost per unit of product that she uses.

With the new child, it's going to be five people that she will be supporting. This is obviously no small task, especially considering her husband is not around to help her. He works sporadically as a mason. She is placing her hopes very high, intending to send all of her children to the university in the capital city of Santo Domingo, some 45 kms. away from their home.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has lived in this house for eight years. She has five kids, one with a former husband. Her present husband has a small shop where he dedicates himself to iron works. When we asked her husband about who helps whom in the family, he stated that it is he who helps her, as her business is smaller than his.

Julia's business is selling clothing which she normally buys in the capital, Santo Domingo, where there is a secondary market for the Haitian packs ("pacas") of new and used clothing that are sold in the border towns, which become major trading markets between Haitians and Dominicans at the beginning and end of the week. As the majority of the Haitian people are very poor, they get donations in the form of new and used clothing. They pack these into "pacas" and bring them to the border in order to convert the goods into money they can use to buy food and other necessities. Their Dominican counterparts take this opportunity to purchase goods at discount prices, so that they can in turn use these low-cost (usually high-quality) products for sale back in their hometowns.

Julia doesn't have the opportunity to make the long trip (usually a whole day) to the Haitian border. because the trip to Haiti is expensive. The cost runs anywhere from $25 to $30 in public transportation (roundtrip). However, she needs to take the time and trouble to buy these products if she wishes to make the profit margin which hopefully will more than justify the sacrifice involved.

loans.use: Take an expensive trip to the Haitian border to buy bundled clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is originally from Escobedo in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She is a married mother of six children, all of whom are also married. Her husband is retired, and to be able to meet their basic necessities Gloria started her own business eight years ago selling clothes and toys. She has a post at the local markets, and little by little her stock has improved, increasing her sales. With the help of her children she has been able to make her business grow.

Currently, Gloria is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase supplies in order to offer her clients a wider selection and stay on their good graces. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be a part of Gloria's success. Gloria and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene siete hijos, todos ellos ya casados. Su esposo es jubilado y para poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar Gloria inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes hace ocho años, se instala en los mercados ambulantes y poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor, incrementando sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus hijos ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Gloria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Gloria y decídete a apoyarla hoy, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and toys

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco is a hard-working and responsible man. He's married, and his wife stays at home and takes care of their three small children. Lacking employment and needing to provide for his family, Francisco started his own business six years ago. He installed a mechanic shop on his home's patio, taking advantage of his knowledge of the trade to provide a good service to his clients. He soon found success and grew his business by purchasing more specialized tools.

Currently, Francisco is requesting a loan of $925, which he will use to purchase equipment and tools he needs to keep his business growing and improving his service. He plans to repay the loan within six months. Your support will be a great help in this business' development. Francisco is very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus tres pequeños hijos. Ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de darle sustento a su familia desde hace seis años Francisco inició su propio negocio, en el patio de su casa instaló un taller mecánico, aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene de este oficio pudo ofrecer un muy buen servicio y pronto logró hacer crecer su negocio comprando herramienta más especializada.

Ahora Francisco necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de equipo y herramienta que necesita para continuar creciendo y mejorando su servicio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio, Francisco agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchase car repair equipment and tools

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalila is a married mother of two children, students ages 15 and 17. Her husband worked at his father's printing shop, where he learned the trade. To cover household expenses and afford their children's education, Dalila and her husband decided to start their own business offering printing and bookbinding services. They started doing small jobs out of their home, and very soon they obtained many more clients thanks to the high quality of their services.

Dalila and her husband want to see their business continue to grow, and to achieve this they are requesting a loan of $925, which they will use to purchase computer equipment to improve the quality of their designs and printings. They hope this will increase their production and improve the services they offer. Dalila plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her family are sincerely grateful for your support and confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Dalila es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 15 y 17 años de edad, ambos estudiantes. Su esposo trabajaba ayudando a su padre en su propia imprenta, ahí es donde aprendió el oficio y para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos entre Dalila y su esposo decidieron iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de impresión y encuadernación. Comenzaron realizando pequeños trabajos en su hogar, y poco después gracias a la buena calidad de sus servicios lograron tener muchos más clientes.

Dalila y su esposo desean que su negocio continúe creciendo y para esto necesitan un préstamo de $ 925 dólares con los que comprará equipo de cómputo para mejorar la calidad de diseño e impresión, con esto esperan incrementar su producción y mejorar el servicio que ofrecen, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Dalila y su familia agradecen sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que depositas en ellos.

loans.use: Purchase computer equipment

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard-working woman. She's a married mother of three. Her husband is a businessman, and their children are grown up and live outside their home. To help her husband with household expenses, Maria started her business selling lingerie six years ago. She started out selling to friends and family, and thanks to their recommendations she was soon able to increase her clientele and grow her business.

In order to offer a better service to her customers and to fulfill all their orders, Maria is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within three months. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo se dedica al comercio y ahora que sus hijos están grandes y ya no viven con ellos, para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar Maria emprendió su negocio con la venta de lencería hace seis años, empezó vendiendo entre sus familiares y amigos y gracias a las recomendaciones de éstos pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y surtir todos los pedidos que tiene Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Maria agradecen mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase lingerie supplies

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha Isabel is 33 years old, married and lives in Guadalupe in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Her husband works as rehabilitation assistant. To be able to support him with household expenses, Martha took an arts and crafts course five years ago, where she learned various techniques to make decorative works. Through this, she was able to earn extra income, and thanks to the originality of the products she makes, her customer base and her demand is growing.

To keep her business growing and increase her production, Martha is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be part of the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martha Isabel tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y vive en la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León. Su esposo trabaja como asistente de rehabilitación y para poder apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar desde hace cinco años tomó un curso de manualidades, donde aprendió varias técnicas para elaborar artículos de decoración, de esta manera es como obtiene un ingreso extra y gracias a la originalidad de los productos que elabora ha conseguido tener muchos clientes y una creciente demanda.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio e incrementar su producción Martha está solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra materia prima, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a apoyar a Martha.

loans.use: Purchase art supplies

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio is 26 years old, in an open relationship and has a 2-year-old son. To cover household expenses and improve the quality of life for her son, Rocio started selling shoes six years ago. She started out selling to family members and later, thanks to the simplicity of her payment plans, she increased her customer base. Fortunately today she supplies a larger number of orders and has been able to grow her business.

Currently, Rocio is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer her clients a wider selection and improve her service. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be a part of this business' development and help Rocio and her family. They are sincerely grateful.
