Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rocio tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y después para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo Rocio se dedica a la venta de zapatos, inició hace seis años vendiendo entre sus familiares y después gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofrecía fue incrementando su número de clientes, afortunadamente hoy surte una mayor cantidad de pedidos y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Rocio necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en sólo 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a Rocio y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Eva Esmeralda

texts.es:
Eva Esmeralda is a married mother of two children, one in elementary school and an infant. Her husband works in an office, and to help him with household expenses Eva opened a convenience store a year ago in Sabinas, Nuevo León, where they're from. She started selling only drinks and snacks at first, but now has been able to better stock her store and is making it grow thanks to the good service she provides.

To meet her customers' demands and increase the variety of products, Eva is requesting a loan of $925, which she plans to repay within six months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and help move Eva and her family forward. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Eva Esmeralda está casada y tiene dos hijos uno estudia la primaria y el más pequeño tiene poco tiempo de nacido. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una oficina y para poder ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar Eva emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace un año en la localidad de Sabinas, Nuevo León de donde son originarios. Comenzó vendiendo sólo refrescos y botanas pero ahora ha podido surtir bien su negocio y ha estado creciendo gracias al buen servicio que ofrece.

Para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de los productos que ofrece Eva está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Eva y a su familia a salir adelante, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is a married mother of three and lives in Sabinas, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Her husband runs a carpentry business, and all of their children are married. They live alone except for one of their grandchildren who also depends on them economically. To help her husband with household expenses, Manuela started selling a few paper products five years ago. She later was able to better stock her business and now has a larger customer base.

Manuela wants to take advantage of her desire to keep working and continue growing her business, which is why she's currently requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies and a display window to showoff her products better. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Manuela and her family are very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la localidad de Sabinas, Nuevo León. Su esposo tiene una carpintería, todos sus hijos están casados y con Manuela y su esposo sólo vive uno de sus nietos que depende económicamente de ellos, para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, desde hace cinco años comenzó vendiendo muy pocos productos de papelería y después fue surtiendo mejor su negocio, ahora cuenta un amplio número de clientes y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Manuela quiere aprovechar ahora que tiene fuerzas para seguir trabajando y desea hacer crecer su negocio por lo que ahora está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de una mejor manera, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Manuela y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and a display window

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario is a very hard-working and responsible married mother of three. To improve her family's quality of life, Maria started working as a door-to-door saleswoman, but she didn't earn a sufficient amount. She then decided to go out on her own and opened her own convenience store three years ago. Thanks to the good service she provides she has been able to grow her business and increase her sales. Love for her family is a constant motivator.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer a wider variety of products. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in this business' development. Maria is grateful for the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Maria comenzó a trabajar con las ventas, las realizaba casa por casa pero no recibía una remuneración suficiente, entonces decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace tres años, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. El amor hacia su familia es lo que la motiva a esforzándose más cada día.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom M. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and their 3 children.  She works selling bananas and raising pigs, and earns about $3/day.  Her husband earns $2.5/day working as a horse-cart driver.  This loan will be used to purchase pigs to raise and also bananas for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and bananas

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy Mukunga M. is a soft-spoken, 27-year-old single gentleman. He lives with his parents and two siblings at the Garden estate on Thika Road, Nairobi. Kennedy operates a cyber café, at the Kenyatta Market, Golf Course Centre. He offers Internet services, photocopying, word processing and printing services and even telephone and document-binding services. He has often provided support services to the Action Now Kenya office, as well as to many other companies in the area.

Kennedy went to the Kenya School of Professional Studies where he took courses in IT (Information Technology) from 2001 to 2003. After his studies he got a job at a Video Library located at the Garden estate where he worked for two years. In the year 2005, he was employed at a hardware shop located at Donholm estate, East of Nairobi. He was inspired by his father to set up a cyber café, and with his father's assistance together with the little savings he had put aside, Kennedy set up the cyber café in April 2006. This has helped him a great deal because it has uplifted his life since then, and unlike many youths of his age in Kenya, he does not have to depend on his parents for his personal expenses.

Kennedy now wishes to expand his business in order to be able to do colour printing, which currently he is not able to do. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 250, which will enable him to purchase the colour printer. This will go a long way toward giving his clients quality services which will translate into higher income. Kennedy intends to repay the loan within 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase a colour printer

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn H. is 53 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their five children.  She and her husband own a grinding mill to service people in the local community that have rice crops.  They also own some land where they grow their own rice.  This business only gives the couple a combined income of $2/day.  Two of their children work at a garment factory and are able to supplement the family income.  This loan will be used for the couple to purchase a tractor to use on their land.  It will help them to improve their efficiency and their income.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor for cultivating their land

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Wainaina N. is a 42-year-old man, married with four children. Apart from his children, N. supports his aged parents and also takes care of HIV infected and affected people in his community by providing foodstuffs to the affected homes on a weekly basis.

Wainaina started his business in March 2007, his dream come true since he had had a passion to start up a kerosene pump business. Wainaina can be described as a very hardworking man. He previously had set up a small dry cleaning business, which was financed by his benefits from a Nairobi transport provider, Kenya Bus Service Company, after he was laid off. This business was operational from 1998 to 2002. Apart from his business, N. is also a community worker within Kayole where he resides. He runs a small community based organization by the name of AIDS Link, and he is sometimes hired by NGOs and social work groups to assist in matters affecting his community.

Through his hard work, and from the payments he received from the transport company, N. managed to save up Ksh 95,000 (US$ 1440), which he used to start off his kerosene-selling business. He has undergone several business management training courses and has gained a lot of experience, both from the dry cleaning business that he used to run and also from the kerosene business that he is currently operating.

N. wishes to expand his business. His vision for the business is to become able to sell on a wholesale scale in his area. His only difficulty is finances necessary to stock more kerosene, which is the main fuel used for cooking within his community. He is requesting a loan of US$ 800, which will be repayable within 12 months. The loan will enable him to expand his kerosene business and attract more customers, since he will have enough kerosene to meet the needs within his community. This will also enable him to make his prices more reasonable, a great advantage to his customers. The additional stock will also require him to employ 2-3 people from his community, to assist him in serving the customers. The additional loan will enable him to increase his income, hence improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase 5 empty metal drums and 1000 litres of kerosene

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon Mwaniki is 38 years old and married. He has no children of his own but has two dependants, his aging parents whom Simon entirely supports. Simon Mwaniki lives in Ruai.

Simon was first employed in a lumber-selling business in the year 2000 and worked for three years. During that period, he managed to save Ksh 40,000 (US$ 615). The three-year experience also gave Simon enough confidence to start his own lumber business, which he still has to date, though with some struggles.

Simon’s business suffered a setback in the year 2006 due to his wedding preparations, which ended up causing him huge unforeseen costs relating to the culture and traditions of his tribe that he was expected to adhere to, if he was to receive their blessings to marry his bride. Through this time and due to the financial strain that Simon experienced, his business suffered and he still finds it hard to bring it back up again. Simon needs support in order to revive his business again. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1000, which he will use to purchase lumber to restock his business. He will be very grateful if he can receive this support, in order to improve his business.

Simon believes that once he has additional stock, his customers will be able to purchase enough lumber to meet their needs, especially those who purchase in bulk. This will save them the inconvenience of having to travel all the way to the city center to buy lumber, at a much bigger cost to them. The loan therefore will enable him to serve his customers efficiently and effectively. He will also earn more income so as to uplift himself and his family. The loan repayment period will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for sale

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung B. T. is a 54 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her 4 children.  She works selling Khmer noodles to local villagers, and also raises pigs to eventually sell to the market.  Through these businesses she makes about $1.5 per day on average.  Her children work as translators and hair-dressers, and they each earn around $5 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase more pigs to raise, a business that Mrs. Kung B. T. is comfortable with and would like to expand.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

payments.comment: Congratulations to Kung Bun Thoeun for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. is a 33-year-old man, married, with one child. Julius lives at Mlolongo, an informal settlement along the Nairobi – Mombassa highway. Apart from caring for his young family, Julius has the burden of taking care of his brothers and sisters after losing both of his parents.

Julius started his restaurant business in the year 2006. This was after he and the other employees he worked with were sent home after the chain of supermarkets they were working for came under receivership. Since Julius had experience in dealing with customers while at the Uchumi supermarket, his former workplace, he decided not to waste his skills. He therefore ventured into the restaurant industry, where he felt that he could make use of his skills while at the same time earning some money for the upkeep of his family and siblings.

In order to finance the start-up of his business, Julius sold one of his cows for a total of Ksh 18,000 (US$ 300) and put this amount in, together with his personal savings of Ksh 40,000.00 (US$ 670), which he had put aside while still in employment. With this, he opened his business in the year 2006. The business has since been doing very well, and Julius now feels that he wants to improve the business by adding on some kitchen equipment. This will include a cooker, a refrigerator, a French fries warmer, a juice extractor, a blender, and some cooking fat. These will enable him to give his clients quicker and better service.

The population within the Mololongo area is rapidly growing and Julius wants his business to grow with the rising number of potential customers. For this reason he is kindly requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that he can fully equip his restaurant.

Given this loan, Julius feels that he will be able to give his customers the very best service. He will also be able to employ 2 young men to assist him in running the business, thereby benefiting the community by creating employment. The repayment period for this loan will be 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of restaurant kitchen equipment

loans.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous N. is a 48 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her two children.  She works by farming their land, and also selling liters of gasoline.  Her children help her to sell gasoline to motor-bikes and cars traveling by.  The family can earn nearly $10/day when they pool their income.  They currently don't have the capital to purchase more gasoline to sell, even though they know it is profitable.  They will use this loan to purchase more gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah N. Kariuki is a 42-year-old man, married with two children. He lives in Kitengela town in Athi River, in the Eastern Province of Kenya. Jonah started singing while in school. His music teacher noticed his musical talent and nurtured him to the point where he became a seasoned singer by the time he was through with his music lessons.

After school Jonah married Bilha Njeri who also is a gospel singer. Together, in the year 1995, they released their first album by the name of “ Ngai oiga ni oiga” meaning “if God says he has said it”, which consists of 12 songs. This album sold like hotcakes and with the proceeds Jonah was able to rent a shop in Kitengela and buy a generator which up to now he uses to preach the word of God and advertise his cassettes.

Jonah has a soft heart for children and has started a children’s home in Ruai town, on the outskirts of Nairobi. The children’s home, Fire Ministry Children’s Home, takes care of 45 orphans. Apart from the orphans at the children’s home, Jonah takes care of his sister and her 2 children because she is sick and unable to take care of them. He also takes care of the 5 orphaned children of his sister-in-law who died of HIV/AIDS in the year 2000.

Well aware of advances in music production used to recorded on CDs and DVDs, Jonah wants to go HI-TECH with his music. Therefore he is requesting a loan of US$1200. Given this loan, he will purchase a keyboard, amplifier, two speakers, and a microphone. With this equipment, he will be in a better position to produce music on CDs and DVDS and through this, he will earn more income. This will enable him to spread the gospel and provide for his very big family. The repayment period for the loan will be 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a keyboard, amplifier, etc. to use to produce gospel recordings

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong K. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their five children.  She works by selling porridge and helping her husband to operate their pool hall.  The family makes a total of $7/day from these businesses, but they would like to build another pool hall for local youth to play at.  This loan will be used to purchase another building in which they will put pool tables and charge hourly rates.

loans.use: To purchase a pool hall

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem S. is 43 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their 3 children.  She and her husband work on farming their land and buying and selling cows.  Their children work at a garment factory and help to support their family.  This loan will be used to purchase a horse and cart to transport passengers.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart for transporting customers

payments.comment: Congratulations to Kem Sophal for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Achildi

texts.en: Achildi  A. is 55 years old and lives in the Yavan district. He has a high education, specializing in pedagogy. He is married and has 7 children. He has his own storefront, where he has been selling food for 6 months.   With $875 he plans to buy more foods to sell and increase the range of goods. This loan helps to improve the life of district; the next nearest food shop is far away. District inhabitants have opportunity to obtain food near their homes, they do not need go far for food.  Achildi is going pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: to buy foods and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mr. Sek S. O. is 24 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with his wife and their only child.  He works as a cameraman and earns $3 per day, while his wife earns $2 per day working as a fruit-seller.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle.  Public transportation is very expensive, so Mr. Sek S. O. knows this will save him money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work

loans.name: Thum

texts.en: Mr. Thum P. is 66 years old and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham Province.  He owns a plantation that grows various crops, which gives him an average income of $4 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase seeds and farm supplies for him to increase his efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm supplies

payments.comment: Congratulations to Thum Phai for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Toun

texts.en: Mrs. Toun C. is 37 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their three children.  She works as a farmer and earns $2.50 per day, while her husband earns $3 per day working as a construction foreman.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband and sons to go to work.  This way, they will not have to pay a moto-taxi driver daily and it will thus save the family transportation costs.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Dib

texts.en: Mr. Dib D. is a 49 year old school director living in Kampong Cham Province.  He earns $5 per day from his job, and he also works with his wife on their farm in their free-time.  Together, they have six children.  This loan will be used to purchase a thresher machine to harvest rice.

loans.use: To purchase a thresher

loans.name: It

texts.en: Mrs. It S. lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband.  She works as a grocer, earning $2.5 per day, while her husband is a farmer who makes palm sugar.  He can usually earn between $1 and $2 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase grocery products and the remainder of the loan will be used to buy tools and supplies for producing wine.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products and to make wine

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 35 year old multi business man. He is married with three children, all below ten years. Rashid is a cameraman: he runs a photo studio, a poultry business and a vegetable garden. He has been a cameraman for the past 15 years; the poultry and the vegetable businesses are just three years old. Rashid gets tenders to shoot and supply chickens for weddings and other ceremonies. He has recently received business training from Youth Self Employment Foundation and photo studio management training from KODAK. He has employed three people to assist him. His wife also assists him in the poultry and vegetable farming business.

Rashid is now requsting USD 400 to help him buy some equipment for his studio and to stock more chicks.

loans.use: Expand His Studio and Poultry farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30 year old dynamic mother of one. She is a resident of Vituka area in Dar Es Salaam. Mary runs a shop dealing in ladies’ garments, children’s’ clothing shoes and sandals. She deals in both new and used clothes. She buys her stock from Kariakoo, and she stocks depending on the season and the demand by the clients. She has been in business for the past three years and her business has been prosperingever since she joined micro finance institutions. She has received business training from the Modern Commercial Institute and others from the yearly trainings organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation.

Mary also runs a nursery school in Vituka area, where she employs four teachers. She is currently in need of USD 550, to help her expand her store's stock and invest more in her nursery school.

loans.use: Expand stock and the Nursery school

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 35, is married with five children, two in secondary school and the rest in primary school. She runs a shop in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam’s-and perhaps Tanzania’s- biggest trading area. She deals in cosmetics, decorations, children's toys, and stationery. She has been in this business for the past four years and is both a wholesaler and retailer.

She currently faces a lot of competition and as such, has decided to attract more customers by increasing the variety of stock for her shop. She is also planning to open up another shop, outside the city center. Joyce recently obtained a loan of USD 1,000 which she paid back in full. She is now in need of USD 1,200 to help her buy more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: Buy Stock, expand bussines

loans.name: Mirzomiddin

texts.en: Mirzomiddin S. is 26 years old and lives in the Yavan district. He has a paraprofessional medical education. He is married and has 1 child. He worked as nurse in a local hospital. The salary was too low to take care of his family so he started his own business.  He has a store in a central market of the Yavan district where he sells sport clothes and footwear. He has had this business for 6 years. For the loan amount for $750 Mirzomiddin is going to increase the range of goods he has to sell.   Sport clothes are very popular among youth and now they would the opportunity to obtain them in a local market.   Mirzomiddin is going to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: to obtain new range of sport goods and footwear

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en: Ikromiddin S. is 32 year old and is married with 4 children.  He got in first trading experience in Russia. He saved money and came back home to start his business in Yavan. Now he has had a storefront in the “Tijorat” market for the last 10 years, where he sells men's trousers and shirts.  As the summer season is ending, Ikromiddin would like to borrow $575 to buy autumn mens wear. He has a wholesale trade so the prices to his goods are lower than other sellers. That helps to local habitants obtain goods in a lower price.  Ikromiddin is going to pay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loans.use: to increase the range of goods (to buy seasonal menswear)

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar has a small shop selling women's garments in the Panjshanbe market. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is dead. Her elder son is old enough to help his mother to arrange her goods in her trading place. She currently brings her goods from Bishkek, Kirgizistan.

She became a client of Micro Invest in March, 2007. Her first loan was 100USD. The loan permitted her to expand her assortment and attract more clients. Now she wants to buy her goods from Turkey. The garments from Turkey have good demand among clients. She plans to spend her future loan for purchasing seasonal garments from there. She is requesting 800USD for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of garments

loans.name: Usmon

texts.en: Usmon P. is 33 years and is married with 4 children.  He has had a shop in a Yavan market where he sells auto car parts for 6 months.  For the loan amount for $1000 Usmon plans to obtain new auto parts for new types of cars, which are in great demand.  This business brings locals benefit; it is means that they do not need go far from the district to obtain necessary auto parts. Usmon plans topay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loans.use: to obtain auto car parts

loans.name: Muhammadali

texts.ru:
Muhamadali is employed by a construction business which builds private houses. This is the main source of his income. He does this during active construction seasons. In his free time Muhamadali and his wife sell vegetables at a local market. His produce is in big demand and sells quickly. The profits are enough to supplement the family budget and provide for the family. Muhamadali is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He purchases vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and sells them retail. This year in January he took out a loan from Microinvest and used it to increase his working capital. Currently he wants to take advantage of low costs of potatoes and onions by using a new loan to purchase these products. The picture shows Muhamadali's wife selling her wares at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elena Sheyner, Kiva volunteer.

Мухамадали занимается строительством частных домов. Сейчас для его деятельности наступил сезон, и он активно этим занимается. Это его основной доход. В свободное время он и его жена торгуют на рынках овощами. Его продукция пользуется большим спросом и быстро раскупается. Прибыли остается достаточно, чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет и прокормить семью. Он женат, ему 42 года и у него трое детей. Товар покупает оптом у местных производителей и потом продает. В январе этого года он получил займ в Микроинвест и пополнил свой оборотный капитал. Сейчас цены на лук и картошку минимальные и он хочет получить новый займ для их закупки. На фото Вы видите его жену.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and onions

loans.name: Fri

texts.en:
Fri is a wife and mother of five children. Her husband does not make sufficient money to meet the educational needs of their children. This need and her desire to see her children educated and independent are her motivations. Her determination coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management and experience in retailing raw food stuffs have led her to start a small food retail business.

In the past she was forced to borrow money to purchase goods because the wholesalers used to charge her exorbitant prices for buying on credit. With her current loan request of $100, she will be able to take advantage of the benefits of having liquidity and will probably earn enough profit to help change her life for the better. The first loan repayment installment will commence at the end of the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan

loans.use: Retailing of tomatoes and pepper

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es:
Bernabé lives in the Antofagasta district of the city of El Alto. He makes novel glassware, in different and original shapes, according to the shape of the bottle from which the glass is made. His raw materials are recycled, half-liter, glass bottles. He also works as a driver in a public transportation company (Radio Taxis). With this income he supports his family--his wife and two children who still remain in his care.

He would use the loan to buy empty recycled bottles of different shapes.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted by IMPRO qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Bernabé vive en la zona Antofagasta de la ciudad de El Alto; se dedica a la elaboración de vasos novedosos, de formas diferentes y ornamentales, según el tipo de botella, utilizando como materia prima botellas recicladas de vidrio de medio litro. También trabaja como chofer eventual en una empresa de transporte publico (radio taxis).Con dichos ingresos mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y dos hijos que permanecen a su cargo El crédito le invertirá en la compra de materia prima (botellas vacias de diferentes formas). Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To buy recycled bottes for his glassware business

loans.name: Velushi Gillian

texts.en:
30 year-old Velushi Gillian V. is a single mother of three. She draws her motivation and determination from the difficulties she faces as a single mother in providing basic needs and education to her 3 children.

With a loan of $100, she intends to sell puff-puff and beans, a favorite dish among local inhabitants especially in the early hours of the day and towards the evening. With a regular income, she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs including education and food for her children. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will be made on the date that her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase flour, groundnut oil, firewood, beans

loans.name: Evelyn Mbilah

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Evelyn is married and a mother of five. Her husband does not make sufficient money to meet the educational and health needs of their children. This need and her desire to see her children educated and independent are her motivations. Her determination coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management, as well as experience in making uniforms (a skill she acquired as a young girl) have led her to start a business making uniforms and table place mats.

With a loan of $100 she plans to build her skills in taking credit and repaying timely. She said she will ask for bigger amounts once she is comfortable and sure of her ability to take and repay loans under agreed conditions. The first loan repayment installment shall commence at the end of the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Sewing of uniforms and table mats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more chicks and increase stock in the pharmacy

loans.name: Justina Bi

texts.en:
Justina Bi was born in 1954 and is a single mother of six children. She has suffered a lot of challenges after a car accident left her daughter handicapped, added to her own difficulty in single-handedly providing basic needs for her 6 children. This challenge led her to become a GHAPE member in 1999, where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has obtained and repaid 5 loans. With these loans, she was able to pay for medication for her handicapped daughter and pay school fees for her children. She was also able to feed her children with some of the food she cultivates.

Justina is now requesting a loan of $800 with which she plans to fatten and sell pigs, sell foodstuff and cultivate crops. She will sell some of the crops and feed her family with some, while also paying for school and apprentice fees for her children. She plans to pay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment will be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, till the farm, buy seeds

loans.name: Raymonde

texts.en:
N. Raymonde is 37 years old, a mother of 5 and married to a polygamist. Her toughest challenge has been her past sickness during which she spent all her capital on medication. This forced her to remove her children from school since she could no longer pay their school fees, and her husband was not able to shoulder this responsibility.

Her low self esteem, caused by all these set backs, hindered her from looking for help. She states that “thanks to GHAPE women who talked to me and took me to centre meetings, I heard other women's experiences and realized that I am not alone. This is how I became a member”.

She took her first loan in 2006 and is proud of having successfully invested and repaid this loan with income from her investment. With this loan, she was able to sell foodstuff, fish to her community and provide for some basic needs of her children.

N. is now requesting a loan of $300 with which she plans to sell smoked fish, which is a welcome soup ingredient in her community. She intends to continue using the proceeds from her business to provide for her children. She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: purchase smoked fish, baskets

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is39 years old and married to a polygamist. She has been struggling to set up a business but lacked start up capital and also had difficulties paying for her children's education. Her sister, who was very supportive of her, died, making Veronica more frustrated.

With this loan of $100, Veronica plans to invest in buying and selling fresh corn and groundnuts. She believes that with this loan she will provide for her family's education and also provide food for her family. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will commence from the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Buying and selling of fresh corn and groundnut

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
S. Celine is 35 years old, married and a mother of six. Her motivation to become a GHAPE member in 2002 stemmed from the difficulty her husband faced in providing for her family's basic needs due to his low salary. Upon becoming a GHAPE member she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. She obtained loans and was able to raise money to pay school fees for her children and provide them with balanced meals.

Requesting another loan of $600, she now plans to cultivate crops, feed her family with some and sell the rest to raise money for their school needs. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment will be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, house roof, pay for hired labor

loans.name: Pauline Mankaa

texts.en:
Born in 1949, Pauline Mankaa S. is married and is mother of three living children. Her husband is unemployed so he finds it difficult to provide education and food for his family. In order to assist her husband, she decided to start a business and sought a loan from GHAPE for start-up capital.

After successfully repaying the loan, she now requests another loan of $400 with which she plans to increase her business of cultivation and selling of crops and off-license (liquor store) so she can earn money to buy food for the family and pay apprentice fees for her children.

She plans to pay the loan in 18 months, and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase food items, crates of beer, cigarettes, kola nuts, construct a canter

loans.name: Ndoh Vincent

texts.en:
Ndoh Vincent has been of great help to his family who look up to him as their provider. Even though he is unmarried and has no children of his own, his late younger brother left behind three children to care for. As an unemployed man, he found it difficult to provide for the children's basic needs so he sought help from GHAPE and was trained in business skills. He has already received loans up to $1,000 to pay for the children's education.

He is now requesting a loan of $1,200 with which he will buy and fatten pigs and goats to be sold for meat to restaurants. He plans to repay his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, pig feed, goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motor bike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix his store up

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz and her sister opened this store about 4 years ago. There they sell all types of products to the community ranging from jewelry to office supplies. Cruz and her sister started off by putting together savings and selling just paper, pens and other school supplies. As they grew, they began to invest in many different products to sell.

Although the business was going well, Cruz’s sister married about a year and a half ago and made the decision to move to a new city. Obviously, this affected Cruz. She had to make monthly payments to her sister in order to repay for the capital she put up. Instead of having two people invest in the business, Cruz found herself alone and limited by the payments. She used a loan from Kiva and Mifex to help her get past the tough times and this resulted in a great deal of help for her.

Cruz is now seeking this loan in order to invest in completely new products now that she is finished paying her sister. She is confident in her ability to sell and assures lenders that there is sufficient demand to justify an investment. She is happy to be able t provide for her two children.

loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new merchandise

loans.name: Jesenia

texts.en:
Jesenia is 27 years old and works selling clothes in the local community. She started the business with about $400 she had accumulated as savings from a job in a factory. When she started off, she only sold clothes for babies and young children. As the time has passed she has began selling casual clothing for men and women.

She hopes that with this, her second loan, she will be able to continue to invest in cosmetics and accessories, which are much more profitable than clothing sales. Jesenia already has one child and is pregnant with another. She and her husband are hard workers who want to provide their children with good educations.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue buying merchandise and making aesthetic improvements to her bakery

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.en: Egamberdi E. is 72 years old and is married with 4 children.  He lives in the Yavan district and has a secondary education.  Egamberdi grow up in a village so animal restocking skills is easy for him.  All his life he worked on a collective farm with cattle. He enjoyed his work which gives him an advantage. Nowadays he is in retirement so he devotes all his time for cattle breeding. By borrowing $1000 he is going to buy 3 bull-calves and feed.  This loan helps locals obtain meat for a low price.  Egamberdi plans to pay off the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: to buy 3 bull calves for breeding and selling

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman A. is a 35-year-old married businessman. He runs his small shop in the southern Azerbaijan town of Imishli, where he was born and has lived for his entire life. He has 6 years of experience in his business. He opened his store in 2001 when he first borrowed $1,200 from Aqroinvest CU. He sells laundry detergent, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. These products are in high demand, and Mehman tries to be very polite with clients to gain return customers and attract new ones. Mehman is going to enlarge his store and begin to sell additional food products, for which he needs $1,200.

loans.use: To increase his product selection

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir A. is a 57-year-old married man who has his own petrol station. Zakir lives with his wife and four children in the southern Azerbaijan region near Imishli, in the village of Boshallar. He rented his small petrol station in 1998, repaired the place and opened his business. He and his son work together and over the years they have earned constant customers. Since 2005 the price for petrol in Azerbaijan has increased by 50 percent. To keep his clients he is applying for $1,000 to keep buying the same amount of petrol he was selling before the price increased.

loans.use: To purchase more petrol

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman R.  is a 33-year-old single man. He lives in the southern Azerbaijani town of Imishli. He has seven years of experience; when he started selling goods in his store he was only 26. In the beginning, he sold only biscuits and candies. As soon as he found success, he borrowed $2,300 and purchased goods such as sugar, flour, salt, rice and other goods. Nariman is applying for a $1,200 loan to purchase more beverages and begin selling them, because they are in high demand.

loans.use: To add beverages to his inventory

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
In the past, Nilufar earned a living by making confections at home. She used to sell her products to stores, which then paid Nilufar after selling the sweets to their customers. Gradually growing her business, Nilufar added other food products to her assortment of goods. In the beginning of the year, Nilufar received a MicroInvest loan to purchase more goods. She is single and lives with her parents. Nilufar, 29 has been in business for 5 years. She plans to continue expansion of her business.P.S in the photo you can see her little cousin,because Nilufar is very shy person.Her cousin helps Nilufar in trade during her summer vacation.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur H. is a 26-year-old single businessman. He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the center of the town of Imishli. He started his business 3 years ago. With money he borrowed form his friends he rented a small store and purchased pens, notebooks and markers. In less than one year his business increased and all these goods sold quickly. He enlarged his store and purchased more stationery. Elnur's store is open from early morning until late at night, and selling is going very well, so he decided to apply for $900 loan to add to his inventory computer accessories.

loans.use: To start selling computer accessories

loans.name: Muhaio

texts.en:
Muhaio started her business in 2002 with the trade of socks and underwear. She had $100 in inventory. Gradually she increased her working capital to $500. She brings her goods from Istaravshan, Tadjikistan.

Today she sells perfumes and women’s head scarves. Her business is going well; she has many regular clients. Her trade place is located in Kistakuz, Tadjikistan. Her husband helps her to import her goods from the wholesale market of Istaravshan to her business place. She wants to expand her inventory and add new kinds of perfumes, for which purpose she needs $500.

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en:
Mahammadali H. is a 56-year-old married man who has two milk cows and a calf. He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar town. Mahammadali is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar in 1993 during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. He has been raising animals since 1997.

The first loan Mahammadali applied for was US$ 600. With that amount, he purchased his first milk cow and started to sell milk and yoghurt to the local people. These products are in very high demand in the small towns and villages of Azerbaijan. Later on, with the money he earned from his milk and yoghurt sales, he purchased a calf.

Mahammadali has a big family, a wife and 4 grown-up children, two daughters and two sons. The youngest son helps him to tend the animals, but to cover all the needs of their big family they have to expand their micro-business, so they have applied for this $1,200 loan to purchase one more cow and a calf.

loans.use: purchase one milk cow and a calf

loans.name: Bikenja

texts.en:
Bikenja has been selling children's clothes in the Kistakuz clothing market for three years. She loves children very much. She is married and has 3 children of her own. Her husband is in Russia. He sends money to his family, but it is not enough to support them, which is why Bikenja decided to start her own business. Bikenja brings her goods from the wholesale market, Panjshanbe , to Khudjand.

She is one of the active clients of Micro Invest. Her first loan was 100USD and she spent it for developing her business. Gradually she increased her working capital and expanded her inventory by including several lines of modern clothes for children. She wants to go to the Istaravshan district of Tadjikistan, to the big market there, to purchase goods. She is requesting 600USD for purchasing.

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Born in 1977, Cecilia M. is married to Jonathan Suh and is a mother of 5 children. Her source of motivation is from difficulties she has faced, especially poor health which has resulted in a surgical operation on her leg. This further compounded the situation and the consequences include inability to educate her children even in primary school.
Encouraged by GHAPE borrowers Cecilia became a member of GHAPE and received a loan of $40 in 2003 and since then has proven her ability to receive, invest and repay loans up to the amount of $400. From previous loans she provided her community with fresh food. She is very proud of her achievements especially her success in owning and managing her own business. With profits from these loans, she has been paying children’s school fees. 
Given a loan of $600, Cecilia plans to continue in the same line of business of selling water fufu and Eru and crop cultivation. Water-fufu is made out of fermented cassava. It is palatable with okra and Eru. Eru is green vegetables prepared with smoked fresh  cow skin. When crayfish is added to it and a few magi cubes, even passers-by smell it and saliva is generated. Water fufu and Eru was once a highly appreciated traditional dish in the south west province of Cameroon but today it is widely eaten by most Cameroonians. Her intention is to use the profit to continue to educate her children and take care of her health. Cecilia plans to repay her loan during the loan term.

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs, hire labor, buy wood, transport expenses

loans.name: Chunga Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a husband and father of five children. Health problems have rendered him not strong enough to cultivate crops which are the main economic activity in his community. As a result, he has resorted to rearing animals and producing honey which is less strenuous in his estimation. Due to inadequate capital, he could not raise enough revenue to meet  the needs of his family. Motivated by other GHAPE members in his community, he joined the program and received loans of $40 and $130 in 2005 and 2006 respectively. The profit he got from the loans was used to pay tuition for his children. Given the high demand of his products, there is need for expansion.

Given a loan of $200, Emmanuel plans to repair his pig sty, buy more bee hives and feed for his pigs. His community will benefit from this in that there will be more honey, pork, and manure at their disposal for a better standard of living.

He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Rearing of pigs, goats and production of honey

loans.name: Ochaoy

texts.en:
Ochaoy has over 8 year of experience in trade. She is a married and has 4 children. Her husband is a worker. They are a friendly family and they both work for their children.

Her business is trade of perfumes and it is located in the Kistakuz big market. Presently her business is going well; she has many clients and also she takes orders from them. Today she has one sales assistant and two places of trade. The turnover of her business is fast. She wants to expand her assortment of goods for attracting more new clients. For this purpose she is requesting $800.

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Bah Jeremiah

texts.en:
As a young and aspiring man, Jeremiah has been finding difficulties trying to raise  business capital. He is married and has one child. He had tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had problems of repayment due to high interest rates.
Pig farming is a very profitable business in his community when done on a large scale.
Motivated by his ambitions, Jeremiah joined GHAPE in March 2007. His choice for this trade is as a result of his childhood experience in pig rearing and further business development skills acquired during GHAPE Initial training. Given a loan of $100, he plans to buy 240kg of pig feed since he already has the pigs but faces difficulties feeding them. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Rearing of pigs

loans.name: Jacinta.

texts.en:
Jacinta is newly wedded but her husband cannot provide her with the much needed capital for business. Things got worse when her supportive father passed away. The high interest rates of local banks discourage her from getting a loan but with the advent of GHAPE in her community, she has found refuge. She is confident investing in pig farming as it is an old activity and she has acquired a lot of training in this field.
Her community has been benefiting from her activities in terms of the manure they get.

Given a loan of $100, Jacinta plans to buy two more piglets and 80kg of composed animal feed.

She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Buying of piglets and feed.

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus is married and has three children. As an unemployed man, relying on crop cultivation was not sufficient to take care of his family. He thought of expanding his activities by rearing pigs but hadn’t the capital. This pushed him to join GHAPE  where he received his first loans of $40 and $120 in 2005 and 2006 respectively. These loans empowered him to open up a pig farm but with the increase in the demand of pork, there is need for him to increase his production.

Given a loan of $500, Theophilus plans to buy 10 more piglets and 800kg of animal feed. His community stands a great chance of benefiting from his activities as he will in the long run be supplying piglets to those interested in pig farming.

He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Fattening of pigs for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a mother of six, five of whom are in school. Her father died when she was young and she didn't have  the opportunity to go to school. That’s why she has made up her mind to give the best of education to her children. Realizing the heavy school needs, she vowed to work very hard and sought assistance from GHAPE. She joined the program in 2004. Since her restaurant is located near a school, there is always a ready market. School children have been benefiting a lot from her activities as they always have something to eat in the morning and during break. Given a loan of $300, Martha plans to buy Koki beans, palm oil, flour, yeast and sugar. She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Cooking and selling of food

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar I. is a 37-year-old farmer who runs his own small farm with a little herd consisting of two cows and a calf. Yadigar lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Khochonbli village near Imishli town. Since 1993 when he fled to Imishli from Jabrail during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict, he has been an internally displaced person. Yadigar is married and has one child.

He started his business in 2000, when he borrowed money from his friends and purchased a cow. Later, when he had paid back the debts, the cow began to bring him income and in less than a year, he was able to purchase one more cow and a calf.

When his child was born, life become more difficult so Yadigar has decided to expand his business and purchase another cow and fodder for his cattle for winter. He has applied for a loan of US$ 900. He intends to purchase a good milk cow for about $730 and for the remaining $170, he will purchase fodder.

loans.use: purchase one cow and fodder for winter

loans.name: Achu Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and has six children. His ambition in life is to raise and own his own capital, and to see all his children become responsible citizens tomorrow.  As small steps towards these goals, he joined GHAPE and requested $40 as take-off capital. With previous loans he started a pig farm. Gardeners in his community have benefited from his  manure. Given a loan of $500, Moses plans to restructure his piggery and buy piglets, 160kg of feed and vaccines. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Reconstruction of pig sty and buying of piglets

loans.name: Zefer

texts.en:
Zefer Q. is 28-year-old retailer who runs a small cosmetics and perfume store in Qizilkend village near Imishli town, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Zefer opened his store in 2003, when he was only 24. He recently got married and has 1 child. Summer temperatures in Imishli reach a sweltering 50C so people do not stay long when they come into the store.

Zefer has applied for a loan of US$1200 to purchase and install a new air conditioner and give his customers a chance to enjoy a cool comfortable search for the items they want to purchase. Zefer notes, "Most of the customers who come into my store are women. They like to spend a lot of time searching for cosmetics or perfume and I want to create a comfortable place for them, even in sumertime."

loans.use: purchase air conditioner for his shop
